Krewe of Barkus parade is one of the five parades in French Quarter. This is one of the shortest route parades that I have been. It starts near the Louis Armstrong Park and march down to the Jackson square. This is a parade with dog. The dog owner will dress them in different costume, accessory, dog hair paint. Some of the dogs are dress in the character of Star War. Somehow this town is a big fan for the Star War Movie. The parade has names it own King and Queen Dogs that lead the parade. Special beads are giving out when the Queen and King nominated dog pass by. 

This a low profile parade compare to all other parade. What I mean low profile is you have to lower yourself by sitting at the sidewalk curb to watch the parade in the same elevation of the dog. Please come early so you can occupy a sidewalk curb. Some of the dog may approach you and you will have a chance to touch them or take a close up picture. This parade is not as good to watch in standing position. 

Alone the parade, there are promotion for the dog adoption, dog food, dog manicure, dog costume, dog treat, dog toy...... Some of the owner put a small dog and the baby and push along with the stroller, some of them carry their dog in the arm, movie set push cart. This is a fun parade with our four legs friend. Many children are in this parade. They give up candies and beads at the route. Some children run out from sidewalk curb to touch the dog when they see a cute one. This may be the only Mardi Gras Parade that is suitable for all ages.

Authentic Ethnic Cuisine #49. Southeast Asia Cuisine. Malaysia and Burmese. 

I miss my home street vendor food. I found it here at one of the Indianapolis restaurants. A great Hokien Mee is not easy to find. This may be the only one I can find outside of Malaysia. Mee is in Malay. It mean noodle. 

I got the dry wonton mee. Most wonton noodle are wet with a lot of soup. Only southeast Asian prepare it dry. The Mee is egg thin noodle cook and mixed with dark sweet soy sauce and sesame oil. They add BBQ pork and wonton. It is sell in Malaysia street food by Chinese descendent. It is very good here. We also got the wet Pan Mee hand made noodle with Burmese touch. They add some dry fried pork fat on top. Very good. 

Lastly is the Malay rice goreng. This is fried rice with Malay shrimp paste. Spicy. Very delicious. I have not seen this dish sold elsewhere in the United state. Our visit here is definitely the best. Love it.

I have this eyes doctor for over 10 years. I see them grow from one store front to two. I am glad to see they won the small business of the year of 2013. This tell a lot from the customer service to their wonderful facility. 

I was greet with smile and offer me a coffee or water while waiting for my eyes exam. It did not take long and they call my name since they are by appointment. I like the new technology they have. They no longer dilate your eyes with chemical. All by eye scan equipment. That make my life easy since I can drive home without the dilate eyes. 

Dr. Teske is very professional and knowledgeable on his exam. I got my result of my eyes passing all the test. Can beat the healthy eyes.

Rare Ethnic food 2 - African cuisine. If you heard about fufu, this place serve this items. It is a starch items that can be commonly found I Africa. This material is pound into flour. The texture is like dough. Very healthy. 

The first course we have is the coconut rice with assorted meat. We have the goat, beef and chicken. The meat is cooked in similar to curry paste but is not curry. The meat was cook for a long time and they separated from the bone. Good dish to have. 

Our second course is the Egusi Soup. It is a mix of ingredient that I not even know. But it is go well with the fufu. It also has a selection of meat of your choice. 

We added puff-puff and moin-moin. Puff- puffins a unique fried dough. Very puffy. The moin- moin is the puréed bean. It is lightly glaze on the outside.

What a experience. This is a 4.5 stars restaurant. Since my wife gave 4 stars, I can give 5 stars to make it 4.5 stars.

Definitely good fast food restaurant. In compare to many fast food, this restaurant is may be top of the list. Right their bowl is my top of the list for bowl under $10 list. I glad someone do it right. I hope they still keep the quality and quantity after one year. Then they are truly 5 stars. 

It is order on tablet at the entrance. You can add meat if you like. We got the pesto pasta with grilled chicken. It grilled and chop chicken. The pesto sauce is good and high class restaurant quality. We also got the forza bowl. It is power bowl has a lot of grain. We got the manzo. Most importantly is the cube steak. Medium well steak cook very well. The grain included roast corn, garbanzo, farro, veggies and more. I definitely recommend this bowl. Best value and best taste. 

The appetizers is Nutella Piatto. Is thin crush Nutella quesadilla. It is delicious. We like the crispy and the good test. Not much of service. Order is by tablet then they notified you with text message to your cell to be pickup at the counter. There is a curb side pickup.

This is a truly five star restaurant. They deserve to be Yelp top 100 list. I think they should be top10. The restaurant is small. If you come in weekend, please reserve before you go. We were doing the spontaneous restaurant hopping. We were lucky to have the last two seats of the restaurant. 

When you walk into the restaurant, you will feel the festival atmosphere of Octoberfest.  The accordion music make it nice and pleasant. He play the familiar tune. I wish the whole restaurant can hold hand like we are in Munich and sing along with the beer on one side. The waitress is very beautiful and very nice. Love the super service here. They are from Munich. 

This restaurant serves the Bavarian region food of Germany and very similar to the food that we have visit in Black Forrest of Germany.  We have the Veal Schnitzel with mushroom sauce. It is delicious!!!! It come with two side. We have the handmade noodle Spaetzle and the hot potato salad. The potato salad has some ham crump to go with it. Hmmmmmm. Are you hungry now? Go enjoy a dish a meal here. I also have the import beer - Paulaner Octoberfest. It is good beer.

I am glad that a just newly opened restaurant reopen for the take out. This restaurant open just before the pandemic. During the pandemic, I was not able to call them for they are open for take out because they not able to reach through the phone. Until recently they announced in Yelp they open for take out. 

Although we could not try their in store BBQ on the Korean BBQ, but one day we will be there. In the mean time, we appreciate they proceed with take out menu for us to try their food. We got the bulgogi and galbi plate. This dish come with white rice and four side dish. I like Korean side dish such as the tasty beans sprouts and the Korean fish cake. 

The Galbi has great marinated sauce. Well grilled, good meat quality, good enough quantity. The food is good for me to

Authentic Ethnic Cuisine #62. Indian Cuisine. 

This cafe is located in the Grocery store. It has it seating area and business location. The place is clean. What I like about is they have the wash hand area if you decide traditional way use your hand to eat. There is a water station for you. 

We started with the chicken wing drums stick. It was delicious. We also got the lamb chop. The meat was process and it is not tough to bite. The meat still present some pink area which is great technique to keep the chop delicious. We also got the veggies curry puff. It was delicious too. My friend got the dosa. It has potatoes inside. It also come with curry soup to dip. It look very decent. 

Lastly is the mutton biryanis. The mutton is soft and good curry surround it. The rice is perfect. The food may have prepared in one tone of spicy level. I actually like it that way. It is indian food after all.

Long Phung open on the thanksgiving day. I have book mark for some time and here I am. If you want to try some Vietnamese food that is not typical serve on normal menu, this may be your place. 

I am glad they open at thanksgiving that we can visit. The restaurant did not look much on out side until you walk in the restaurant. They have good size of space. Their menu is huge. Too many item to select. Even the drink menu give you a challenge since there are many selections. I have order a fruit jam with jelly and basil seed. I like this drink since it has many fruits in it and flavor basil seed. 

The appetizer we have order the fried chicken wing ($3.99) good value. Tasty too. The main courses include sautéed baby clam with rice chip, 7 combinations plate and the Bun Bo Hue. I like sautéed baby clam and I think they are special. Even the seven meat combination look good. The whole plate have eleven items.

It is a 5 stars performance. Price, taste, quantity, and quality is reach it perfect condition. I would recommend this restaurant to a friend. Thanks to Brigitte's review and notice this restaurant six months ago. Finally we have a chance to visit. Love it. 

I got a fruit juice in water. It was delicious to start. Today they have tripe soup with beef. It is cook till everything is soft. The spice was marinated into the tripe. Our main dish is Breaded steak with rice and fried cassava. The breaded coating has some seasoning spice. It the best Colombian breaded steak I have. It is big piece. 

Our next dish is Bandeja di Mi Tierra. It has skirt steak, chicharron, chorizo, sweet plantain, creole potatoes. This is big combination dish. It has great churrasco. The the steak is well seasoning. The chicharron is very crispy and is not tough to bite. I like this dish have a lot to offer. 

Server are very friendly. They also serve breakfast.

Pinellas Park has the best MD Oriental Market in the Bay Area. It is as well as best oriental market in center florida too. 

The market has some sit down area after you buy the food from the deli and you can enjoy immediately. The deli section is big and the selection do change over time. You can get the oriental bakery from this deli too. The market aisle is clearly mark and wide when two carts are met. 

They have great select of the dry goods and starch. If you want to start a restaurant of your own, they have sauces you can get for the Asian cuisine. Of course, please do not discount the yummy munchies. 

They also have good selection of rice wine if you want to use it for drinking or cooking. High grade sake sold here with exterior of the rice was removed and fermented.

They have good dessert you can take home or on the road. Try their sponge cake.

We know about this Japanese restaurant for long time. We did not make it there until now. I have seen friend celebrate her birthday there. Now I know why she choose this place. 

This restaurant seem like mom and pop shop and may be a generation restaurant. We were here for lunch. We start with 3 rolls combo sushi lunch special. This dish has volcano roll, California roll, and fried fish roll. All pieces is delicious. It come with great ginger salad. I like the ginger dressing. The second dish is the Tempura udon. The udon and Tempura are separated. Each one can be a meal by its own. The Tempura has the shrimp and fried veggies. The udon has a bit fried bit root in the soup. Make it good dipping sauce for the Tempura. This is my first order combination Tempura and udon in single one dish. Love it. 

Overall they are 4.5 stars in my book. Good service. Finish lunch less than 40 minutes. It is make for office hour limit.

If you have a dairy problem and love ice cream, you will love this place. It is dairy free ice cream place. It is also the vegan ice cream place. It is a mystery to see what in it and what kind of flavor they serve. We were here walk by and decided to explore. Love the concept with dairy free. I was wondering how it taste without dairy. 

We got the matcha latte and the divine chocolate. It proof itself without dairy ingredients, the taste still can be achieved. The matcha latte has good taste with coconut flakes in it. It is delicious. The divine chocolate has good chocolate taste with rich in flavor. Both scoop are delicious. No taste try. But definitely worth the ice cream in every flavor.

New Tampa has a new interesting grocery store. Taaza is new kid in the block provide the indian grocery choices to shop other than the typical grocery store. Price is affordable for the people who shop here. This is one of the kind. The space is huge. 

They have divided into several sections. The rice section has different rice. Basmati rice is one of the kind. Other included brown rice and Aromatic Kalijeera rice. I never have the Kalijeera rice. It is short grain. The produce section includes fresh veggies, fruit, ground produce like potatoes. They also have long shaped eggplant, baby cucumber, lychee, longan, and more.

They ready to eat section provide convenient for the young people to take home or stop by their cafe to pickup the food you like. The meat market is per your order meat cut. They also has the cheese, ready pre cut food to be cook at home. The sweet section is very tempting.

Great sandwiches shop at Wesley Chapel / Lutz area. It is hidden gem in this location. Very close to 4.75 stars. Definitely worth the try and return for more. The restaurant clerk is very friendly. They did give us try on their squeeze juice. 

We got the Serranito sandwich. This sandwich come with prosciutto ham on the egg. It also has grilled green pepper which is delicious. This almost like breakfast item but it is eye pleasing. We also got some item from seafood section. The Lobster on Cuban. I have Cuban sandwich before, but a lobster Cuban is the first time. The sandwich did pack with lobster. Then it is press like Cuban sandwich. Highly recommended. The sweet chili sauce accompanied well. 

Overall we like this place. It has seafood sandwich, pork, poultry, beef sandwich. Got to try them all. Kid menu also available. Try their fresh squeezed juice. Side item includes conch fritters, cod fritters, empanadas, stuffed potatoes ball are also delicious.

Awesome best walk that the City of Tampa can offer within the city. City planners have the vision since 1970 when they have this prime location. The current finish phase is below Kennedy bridge phase that connect from Water Work Park to the Channelside. 

Thank to the people who working in the city and leadership from many Mayors that provide the city with a world class place for the people. Along the river walk create the economic impact, social impact, healthy living, access, cultural and art district in this revitalized waterfront. The restaurant, museum, downtown resident, and park are all connected. It has made the downtown such as successful living area after dark. 

The new completed phase below the Kennedy Bridge is best section to enjoy. The entrance can be start from the Curtis Hixon Water Front Park. Other accesses are connected to Sheraton of the Riverwalk and MacDill Park. The MacDill Park has some of the parking spot and they gain access directly to Kennedy Riverwalk section. The parking at downtown after 6 pm is free and you can enjoy the sunset and wait for the deco light turn on. The new section is elevated bridge structure over the Hillsborough River has invited the beautiful scene of the Tampa. I can see people Kayak at night, jogging on the bridge, bicycling, taking pleasure walk. Old and young are enjoying it. When pass under the Kennedy Bridge is bridge under bridge make the change of the scenery from one side of town to the other side.

With many feature that the down town can offer, may be one day I will be the resident in this area. This place is beautiful and breathe taking.

It is worthy to save a few lunch money from other restaurants to come to enjoy one expensive food here. By the all the food here is tiny but very delicate. It is very special on each item you have order. The spice does does has a touch from Japan. It is not your typical sushi restaurant. 

We start with Hatsu Yakitori. This is grilled stick with chicken heart. Very unique. The sauce go with it is difficult to be described. It has excellent after taste. Out next course is Taru Okada. They don't have kanpachi but substitute with Mackerel. It includes the tuna tartare and salmon. This is make your own roll. I like the sauce that comes with it. There are three different sauces and each combination have different flavor. 

Our third course is noble ramen. It do not have the quantity but does have the quality. I wish it has more chashu Pork. Nonetheless, it was quite good. The last item is the Kurobuta Pork Belly. Two pieces for $10. I like the toppings and the Pork Belly. Overall is a wonderful experience.

Grille One Nine may be the best happy hour sushi. They also has the $1,$2,$3 item during the happy hour before 7 pm. The sushi rice is better than three other sushi happy hour place I have been to. 

Tonight we have to pick up our car at dealer and pass by this place. I have seen Stacy visited this place before and book mark it for some time. We have ordered the spicy tuna roll, gator roll, Florida roll, and eel roll from the happy hour and order a surf and turf roll from the specialty menu. The gator roll is the is the yellowtail, tuna, atomic aioli, scallions, smelt, and tempura chip. This is a good roll. I also like their eel roll that serve a good eel. 

The specialty surf and turf roll is fried lobster top with seared steak. Mmmm I like this roll. We also added the nigiri smoke salmon and freshwater eel. The service is great. Please call ahead since many come to happy hours.

One of the yelper friend recommends this restaurant to us when we were at Tarpon Spring. The restaurant has it own parking lot and you are not required to pay the parking when you eat there. We met the owner of the restaurant when we eat there. He also own the restaurant across the street. This a good restaurant with reasonable price. 

We order the grilled octopus for appetizer and the lamb chop for the dinner. The octopus tentacles was process and grill over open fire. The minor burn make the whole food smell better. It serve with olive, cucumber and lettuce. It is yum to enjoy. 

The main dish is the lamb chop come with two side. We have the salad and the rice. The salad have the purple olive which is tradition to Greek food. The rice is top with tomato sauce with crispy meat crump. The lamb chop is grilled. Most restaurant serve thin cut lamb chop. This is my first time eating 1 inch thick lamb chop. It also bone in. This make the pod have flavor. Love the chop. 

The service is great. Constantly some people to collect the empty plate. Can beat this chop any where. Very traditional Greek food.

This is about 4.5 stars in my book. I was undecided if it need to be 4 stars or 5 stars. At the end, I think I can revise it for my revisit next time. This place is big. I definitely like the bar area. It has great tv. 

I was here to try out the newest restaurant in the St. Pete area. This is one of the few restaurants has it own parking lot. It is free parking compare to many area here requiring parking fees. It is a plus. 

I got the pork belly ramen to start. This ramen come with 3 good pieces of pork belly grilled to good perfection. I would add salt or sugar to the pork belly with better taste before grilled. The soup may want to add some black sesame oil to enhance the flavor. This ramen is good, however I think just need a slight improvement to make it great. 

I got the chance to try their category five sushi roll. This is a spicy tuna top with avocado and Kabayaki sauce. In addition it top with imitation crab meat. It is a very good roll. Love the taste. The other roll is the their one of most order rolls- snow mountain rolls. This is a tempura shrimp inside and top with real snow crab meat. I think this is a must order item if you visit them. I would recommend this roll. 

Here are the special:  Monday free miso soup for any guest; Tuesday 2 minor rolls for $10, 2 major rolls for $20 and mixed and match for $15; Monday to Friday $2 off on bento box before 3 pm; Wednesday $2 off on each glass wine and 1/2 off for bottle, Thursday lady night alcohol. 

My service is great. A shout to Sarah who serve me did a great job at the bar. Other worth mentioning is their sake cocktail, sake whisky, sake sangria, and their whisky flight.

This an update from the previous take up to current dine in experience. There is no doubt eat at the shop is the best option. The food just prepared and they are good to go. I am considered they are top store for devil crab in tampa. 

We order one devil crab and they are huge. The whole ball is stuff with crab meat. They definitely worth for the money. It come with chip and drink. Do you know the breakfast special is only $5.99 and they give a lot. It includes sausage, ham, scrambled egg, and more. Big breakfast to share. 

After a true sit down visit, I feel they are one of the best in Tampa. It can be easily one of the most like in the bay. If you visit Tampa, this is one you should try. Sandwiches is famous here too but the devil crab is the jewel of the store.

Rare ethnic food # 64. Thai Street Food

This is noodle restaurant has a lot to boast about. It is first Thai street food in the Bay Area. Their menu concentrated on noodle with many different choices. It is a true 5 stars restaurant to my book. I once been to a street vendor in Singapore that received the Michelin Star. This restaurant will be our Tampa Bay Street Food That has Michelin star quality. 

We started with Namtok Moo. It is the grilled slice pork with Namtok sauce with roasted rice powder. The marinated was good. The slice beef is great. Our fist entree is the Ba Mee Moo Dang. It is the BBQ pork with egg noodle. It is a dry both noodle dish. Very similar to Malaysia dry wonton noodle dish except they use BBQ pork. I like the sauce at bottom of the dish. So you need to mixed before you eat will help the flavor. The second entree is the Tew Pad Toon. It is the duck noodle soup. The duck is deboned. The duck is cook in the broil herbal soup. The soup base also from that. I think this dish win my heart. 

We have a lot love for this restaurant. Although it is too far for me to visit but I will make the effort to revisit. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Great restaurant with low cost. This where you find Mc Donald meal is expensive compare to this restaurant. If they start a chain restaurant, it may be a nightmare for Mc Donald to compete. I believe they are the gem of the Bay Area. 

The restaurant get a lot of foot traffic so come a bit early than lunch time. Unfortunately they close at 5 pm so no dinner. Just sad about this situation??? Dummy, you just have to take out and eat at night. However their soup noodle need to be eat there. 

I like their grilled pork sandwich. When they are at the old location, they usually run out of pork when it approaches to closing time. They serve many type of soup. I like their grill pork fresh roll. They also have different dessert in package and you just need to pick one. 

The reason I have this review now is the best keep secret of all time. They serve the duck noodle only on Friday. They use to have this item in the menu at the old restaurant. However, they have not put this dish in the menu when they move to the current location. The duck is well braised with salt and seasoning into the meat itself. This is not a roast duck. If any Vietnamese restaurant use roast duck, it is wrong for duck noodle soup. The soup base is not regular pho spice. You can feel the natural bone taste in this soup. It comes with bamboo shoot. I like it better here due to the shoots are not sour. I have been to many place for duck noodle but non like this. The duck meat and the soup are the one I love the most. Please remember to come early and only Friday serving only. They have limited bowl. Once they are gone they will not serve it again. You also need to like to eat from the bone for this soup. 

I have been here many time but never review them, I have kept this duck noodle soup secret for years in the current location. Only the loyal old customers know about this. Don't forget about the boba drink. They are very affordable. Here you go, the secret is out.

East Bistro offer stone oven food that is delicious. Under $10 you can filled you stomach with great food. This is small businesses we need to support. I think they are better alternatives than the fast food such as McDonald. 

I pass by here a lot but never go into the restaurant. This restaurant has some sit down place. This is almost like cafeteria order at the counter and pick up the food. However, they have good food. I have order to go. I have order the Kibbeh, beef kabab and atayef. The kibbeh is ground beef in cracked wheat shell. It is delicious. The kabab are the kofta with season ground beef and grilled over the open flame. It come with rice, baba Ghanoush and tabouleh. Mmmm good. I also have the dessert that is not in the menu. The Atayef-Arabic pancake stuff with walnut. They fried and dip in honey syrup before it serve. 

I gave 5 star for good pricing, good food, fresh ingredients, cook on the spot, and attentive service.

I have been to Straz Center countless time since my wife love performance art. I have been to the Carol Morsani Hall and Ferguson Hall many time. They even have a smaller hall like Jard Theater that I have not been to. 

Our kid is involved in the production of the Opera Tampa in this performance art center. His production include Carmen, Tosca, La Bohime, and The Girl of the Golden West. We had driven him to practice and sit in the actual show. The show has very talented singers and actor. This production take time and they only show for two days. 

Recently we have attended the Florida Orchestra with a small section of Madam Butterfly. The lead singer is the principal of St. Petersburg Opera. It is wonderful singing. 

The center include a restaurant, education center and more. I glad we have somethings like this in town.

In search of ramen, we decided to try this place base on a friend review and the roll char siu pork. 

The place has nice modern decorations with high ceiling. Great dining hall. Plenty of seats. One thing they lack off is customers. It is light traffic consider 6 pm in the Saturday evening. We were easily seat by our choice. 

We know they have the Ramen menu. They also have special of the night menu also with different sushi with picture. The pictures of the sushi look good. We are not trying that because we have few more stop for different restaurants. 

The ramen soup base have the miso, shoyu, tonkatsu, shio butter or the mix of tonkatsu and miso. Among of all the soup base, the tonkatsu base is the holy grail of the ramen. It is from pork marrow bones depend on how long it was cook. They were kind enough to allow us taste the soup before order. 

The Ramen was good and not too salty since they are not the miso base. Overall they are good to try and the ramen came out in 10 minutes. Base on the interior and the people who serve us, they deserve 5 stars. We will be back to try the sushi.

It is located at the empty lot of the corner Nebraska and Sinclair Hill road just north of the Bearss Ave. it is at the southeast corner of the intersection. Look for the red color hut or trailer. Sometime they it has smoke come out the smoke ventilation tube. 

If you like the BBQ, this may be your joint. Be prepared the front row seat. What! no seat at all. Just standing and eat or take home :). The BBQ certainly a great one in Bay Area. I have not try the mullet but the meat samplers is great. The samplers have the chicken, pull pork, rib, sausage, beef brisket. It is a big dog dish for one person. 

This shack was burn down and now reopen. He take credit card. I would bring cash. Parking is easy, just pull to the front of the shack. You also can buy the rib by the count of bones. They are easy to order base on your appetite. Come check it out yourself. If you don't like it, blame Nick.

Bull Grill is truly the Brazilian Grill in the Bay Area. The restaurant is actually located at the vibrant Hispanic Community neighborhood. It is easy located at Armenia a few block south of the Hillsborough. Love the setting inside. It does not matter dinner or lunch, it is cloth napkin service. The best time and value is the Saturday and Sunday lunch because weekday you have to return to work and you cannot stay long. 

The restaurant is my first time try on. I have tried many Brazilian and fell that they are too salty or too much of MSG in the seasoning. However, this restaurant is different in very good way. The seasoning is perfect and not over power. Love the food here, it come with wave. I mean tidal wave!!! Please pace yourself for the meat. There are 10 different cut of beef. In addition to the beef, they have chicken, chicken heart, ham and pork. My favor is the chicken heart. The beef have Picanha, Alcatra...... Forget about the names; just ask the waiter to cut for you if it is look good for you. Love it, eats it; what do you waiting for if they already bring in front of you. 

Kim is the owner that super nice to us. Our table got free three different deserts - the tres-leches, tiramisu, and Flan. I like the tres-leches. They make the tres-leches very spongy and soak well with the milk. This is a great desert that make in Spanish recipe. I forgot to mention, there is more behind the all you can eat salad bar. I like the mango salsa. They also prepare the paella, different type of chicken at the salad bar. 

The service is good, the meat in good material, the choice is a lot, and the people are nice. Love this place and will be back. They deserve a five star for all the above.

Gourmet or Craft bread. You decide. Either way, they have good bread. This bakery with the name 20 shekels is equal $5.06 USD. I believe the loaf of their bread more than 20 shekels ($7). 

We got a loaf of chocolate blackberry bread. They are delicious. It was interesting how they make it. They use sprouts dough. It is compact, jam, dense. Fill you up quick. 

Other item they have sold include sprouted brioche fruit tart, sprout lemon cake, sprouted banana muffin and many more. Come to check them out for fresh loaf. 

The store sale people are very friendly. They are knowledgeable to answer any questions. I would give them an "A" on the bakery item. Go enjoy yourself a loaf of bread. 20 shekels is very reasonable for the price of the loaf.

Rare Authentic Food No. 22

Hawaiian seafood cuisine in sushi is gaining popular in the Bay Area. But who can do better than Poke Cafe. Very creative on taste and combination of ingredients. It make desired to have it every day. 

The choice is very simple, select you bowl size then the Poke, toppings and then the sauce. They also have individual scoops of each Poke if you go that way. Some other interesting way is Poke in burrito. One of my friends has the burrito with the noodle as starch infill. It actually better than the rice infill. 

We have noodle largest bowl with three choices of Poke. We also have noodle base. The pricing is good compared to many restaurant try to do Poke. Love the taste. This is locally run and the owner do take good care of the customers. Food is fresh all time. For the taste, freshness, creativity, they deserve five stars.

Two years ago the the I have attended this festival and they have a lot local business and local restaurants participating this event. Previously they held this event in Hindu Temple Cultural Center. This year they grew bigger and held it at George Steinbrenner Field. They have more businesses are participation the event. Parking is improving compared to Hindu Culture Center. The only thing was given out is Non AC second level baseball stadium. 

This year winner for the food provided is bonefish shrimp Ceviche. The shrimp has a lot bounce which mean they are fresh. The second place is carrabbas mushrooms sauce. They are very good. This year food vendors are mostly chain restaurants. Restaurant such as bonefish, carrabbas, PDQ, wow that fresh, Publix, jersey mike, and more. The coupon are very sweet. Some give out the free whole pizza.

Great architect building that tower the skyline of the French Quarter. This church is still holding the mass every Sunday. During the mass session, the tourists are not allowed to take picture.

The cathedral is burn down 1788 and rebuild in 1794. There are 12 people buried under this church after they died. They are reverent, military, trustee. Two of them are couple. The windows are staining glass display the Bible teaching. The building has two stories allow the believer to gather. The altar is magnificent when you take the first step in the building. The back of the cathedral is a giant display of organ pipe tube. The ceiling is painted with many picture and nicely done. It really creates a house of God for all people. The outside show the tower of three tier story and three towers. 

We were in the cathedral at the morning with the temperature of 47 degree is an escape to the cold weather. A sanctuary that keep us warm and press on to the next destination. It is free and good to visit place.

The line for dinner is 45 minutes wait. Fortunately they are only one block away from the Canal Street where we can wait and watch the parade. They will assign you a buzzer. And the buzzer range is about 1 block. 

This restaurant is recommended by our taxi driver. He has indicated the local love this place. Tonight we have order Crawfish étouffée and Seafood combo. The seafood combo is the fried shrimp, catfish and oyster. The coating is Louisiana bread coating with dry coat. The cat fish and the oyster is killer in this dish. The cat fish is fresh that do not smell fishy. The fish is soft and tender. The oyster in New Orleans is different and soft after fried. The chef did a very good job. Normal fried oyster is a bit rubbery but the chef here make it almost like raw oyster soft. 

The pre-meal items came with the broil potatoes. The potatoes are inch in diameter. They broiled and coated with spicy salt spice that I could not guess what spice. It is good. The crawfish came with salad with sweet vinaigrette dressing. A bit sweet for me but is good. 

The Crawfish étouffée is one of the New Orleans must try item other than Gumbo and Jambalaya. This is a gumbo soup base material with rice and crawfish. This crawfish is broil alive and the shell is removed. The crawfish then added to the soup base with rice. The dish has more than 30 crawfish tail. This is a good dish.

I was here to have a take out. I have this restaurant bookmark since my friends in yelp M&M has been here. The restaurant is well decorated with Bob Marley picture. They also has salt water fish tank. 

I got the their two best saler in the menu. The oxtail and the jerk chicken. The oxtail was well sauce marinated into the bone. The tail is braised till the meat fall off the bone. The jerk chicken is marinated till enter the meat. Then it grilled to perfection. When you use your finger to eat the chicken, you still can smell the marinated sauce at your finger after you have finished the chicken. Each dish come with rice, stir fry veggies. 

I also got their conch soup. It is a bit fishy but it is good. Love all the food here. Portion is big to feed the hungry person. Price is above the average Jamaican restaurant but the the portion measured up the price.

My revisit was the best. We have a chance to take a photo with the executive chef of the restaurant. We like to thanks Jessica Boyd for setting up our company holiday party here. Definitely have a good time here. Service was excellent. And thanks to Chad Bash to allow us enter the reserved room earlier before our set time. Their special room can can seat 50 people easily and good for smaller wedding party too. 

Tonight I try their different cocktail. Each one has their unique taste. My first one is the salted caramel martini, it is sweet with foam above. Second is the tall and sexy, definitely this tall glass attractive with beautiful waist look glass. If you are thirsty, this is the drink to go. The next is the Bourbon Barrel Aged Spice Sangria, this special make sangria which is great for accompanying the meat dish. The next is I believe scofflaw but not sure. The last is the Midnight Martini to wake me up with coffee drinks. It has good coffee in it. My friend enjoy the Black Widow and the Sacred Margarita. They even pull out a virgin Black Widow for a non alcohol soft drink. It was good for them. The margarita was the best among my friends because it come with fruit press for the drinks before pour. Unique. Some of my friends order the virgin pina colada and Daiquiri. They enjoy it. 

Overall the good are great love the appetizers and main dish.

We love our restaurant street at old height. This restaurant I have bookmark for some time. I love the creative chef went out their own and have their independent restaurant. This business owner did a good job for themselves. We were here on Friday night late after 8 pm. There were seats in this restaurant. The seating area is limited. Very nice clean bathroom. 

Tonight we order three small plate. The escargot, the sear blue fin tuna, and the mussel. The escargot is seat on the bread and pour in wine sauce. It make it perfect when they are soak. The escargot is in good size and they about 10 pieces. Sauce is about the right touch for the escargot. The mussel come with creamy sauce. It is a good dish to pickup not over power the material. 

I like the tuna the best. This a blue fin tuna in belly section. It is a bit fatter and rich in taste. They are likely seared top with a bit soy sauce with fragrant  taste and lay over a special chili sauce. 

The price for the small plate is good. The price of the large plate in about the medium to high side. Not much of seating area but good enough for the night.

Yelping #1300. This one go to the local restaurant that has very good potential. 

Ebisu is new and up coming Sushi restaurant. 8/5 will be their anniversary. They have special for the night. The celebration included live band, special dish, freebies and discount. 

We arrived one day before their anniversary. We got here a little after 5 pm. We were the second group of the day. This place is popular after we have sit down. Many have followed. The menu did not has an spectacular wording to attract you. We have order the early bird special. The special is classic roll buy one get one half off. We have order the spicy tuna, negihama yellow tail, unakyu eel cucumber, Mexican fried shrimp avocado. This roll are fresh and well prepared. 

We also order the Salmon Oyako Don - salmon sashimi with salmon roe and rice. The salmon was very fatty and good. We also got the special of the day, the fatty tuna sashimi. Wow. What a good piece of tuna. Very rich and nice. 

The reason they are true 5 stars is because their quality of the fish is top grade in compare to many Japanese restaurant. It definitely worth the money.

Yelping #1800. This go to the local restaurant has great interior. 

I was here for a solo dinner. I found a place at the bar with great atmosphere. Almost every spots are occupied. The bar has a nice decoration hanging on a T cross beam. I know the owner did not mean it to be sacred flowers on the cross but I think is perfect. 

I start with their signature cocktails. The black widow. It is a silver tequila, agave nectar, blackberry, lime juice and a leave of fresh basil. It do have enough alcohol for the tequila. The blackberry accompanied well. It is a good drink. 

The entree is the Hawaii Delmonico. It is angus ribeye marinated in the pineapple and sweet soy. It is Hawaiian thing. I ask the steak to be medium rare. I was hoping they glaze without over burn because it is sweet. The chef did a good job not just prepared to the order, it caramelized the entire steak. It is great to have it. 

My night is perfect. The bar service is very attentive. I like pre-meal item. The bread with chili bell oil sauce is well balanced. If you think about special occasions with manageable budget, this is a great place to celebrate your occasion.

Authentic Cuisine #60. Mexican dessert. 

This dessert store is one of the kind. I was surprised to bump into it when I shop at this plaza. It has minimum 50 different dessert items that you can choose. The make up of the dessert is eye pleasing. 

I started with cucumber soft drinks to quench my thirst. The cucumber water was fresh and nice. We got esquite as salty dessert. It is the corn and cheese. It is warm and nice. I got the strawberry Fresada. It has chili powder, strawberry slice, some kind Mexican candy. The drink has strawberry smoothie. It is typical interesting drink. 

We also got the popsicle. It has fresh food. Many choices of popsicle. They also has churros ice cream. They also carry tapas like shrimp cocktail in Mexican style. One thing for sure. Your experience here will be one of the kind. It is not like your typical dessert that you normally have.

We think we had been to La Pequena until a friend told me that it not their main restaurant. We actually went to the express. The one that have water mill at the front is the express.  The actual restaurant is actually on the right of the plaza in the same location. This time we get to the right main restaurant. The menu here is definitely different and plentiful to select. 

We have order the salmon special and their beef soup. The food portions are huge. Material is well prepared. Value is definitely there. The salmon is grilled and top with mango sauce. The accompanying sides are rice tostone and fried yucca. The fish is grilled to the way I like it. The beef soup is one of the best. This time we are asking the soup with grilled palomino steak. It has yucca and beef meat in tiny pieces. 

When we eat there the next door has salsa music. We saw a lot waiter in and out. We walk across the building door and found the dancing room is part of the restaurant. Very nice. Fern need to be here. Now you eat, drink and play in one place.

If need home cooking, this is your place. The restaurant chef prepare the meal from beginning. A lot of work. The dish that I have need a lot of time to prepare. I have the OX tail that was cook for long time to make it soft. It cook in the Caribbean spice and has a lot of Indian influence. The tail must be slow cook to make it separate from the bone. This dish accompanied with cabbage and the bean rice. You can have the choice of white rice. 

I also have the flower drink - Sorrel. They prepared it and put in the cup and store in their refrigerators. Sweet treat. They have some other food please check it out. They also have fried fish. You can call ahead to have your fish prepare before you arrive. It will take some time to fried. The owner of the restaurant is very friendly. I like about this mom and pop shop.

Great food and good price. This is very much sum up the entire review. It is easy to give this restaurant a good review. The new restaurant do bring a lot good to the neighborhood especially for blue collar workers. If you need a good box food, I recommend this is the place. For me, I prefer to eat there because they just prepare fresh. 

We started with the pork spring roll and chicken egg roll. These rolls are the complimentary from the restaurant. We added the charshu Bao. The spring and egg roll is freshly fried. Very good. The Bao has good steam bun. The price come with three Bao which has a lot of meat. Love the Bao and sauce on it. 

We got the bulgogi and grilled pork noodle bowl. The bulgogi is the best. The steak of the bulgogi is soft and tender. Good to bite. The grilled pork has good seasoning. It is a bit different then most Vietnamese food but I like this way. 

I like restaurants set the food in right price. This restaurant make it to the list. It is convenient to have the box during pandemic. If you cannot finished, you can carry it home.

The first Bubba in Florida. It is sister company of Texas Roadhouse. But I think they are better than Texas Roadhouse and is a improvement. The best thing is affordable cocktails. $4 not bad at all. I got the midnight train and the Frozen All American Margarita. The midnight train is ok. But the Frozen American is wonderful. Next time I will try Long Island ice tea. 

We have the Rib-Eye steak 12oz and Signature Ribeye Steak 14 oz. the regular ribeye just grilled but the signature is marinated. Both are really good because good quality meat. The signature ribeye is marinated in sweet sauce. It is excellent. We also good 12" pepperoni pizza and the raspberry chipotle wing. The pizza is ok but the wing is really good.  

The only thing that need improvement is the reception. It need some work. When the table is available, they need to hurry up shorten the wait line. It just too much for reception to take phone order and lead to table. The service for the table is really good. They have enough people to handle the food delivery and tablE service.

4.5 stars restaurant is correct. This restaurant has been here for sometime. It has great Venezuela cuisine. This restaurant also has great acoustic sound system for the music they play.  

The food here is in good portion. May be enough for second meal. We have the Parilla Mar Y Tierra (mix grilled) and Churrasco. The churrasco have the selection of two side. We have the bacon and chorizo. This side is big. The churrasco is also big size. The seasoning is good. I like my wife entrée better. She has the mix grilled. This is a value dish. You can try different marinated meat. 

They serve different juices. I have the lulo. The service is good. The restaurant is not too busy after 8 pm. But they close at 9 pm. They are well hidden in the corner of the plaza. If you travel southbound Dale Mabry, start looking for it after the village inn.

Great beach for dog. Easy parking area. They have designated area for dog run free on the beach. Some jump into water to retreat the fetch items. Is is definitely a dog owner dream to swim with the dog. 

We brought our grand dog there. He has his fun time there with other dog. Running, playing and resting on the beach. We have to take him to the water for him to swim back. He just need to shake and booties shake to get rid the water. This is the area the dog on the beach without leash. Which is very good for the dog outing. 

We also take him to the dog park at the beach to run. The park has area designated to small or big dog. The park has hose to water down or wash away the body sea water. It is very convenient. Our dog enjoyed the the day on the beach and park and same as the human enjoy the day on the beach.

This Thai restaurant you may not know about it until you have traveled to Seminole, Florida. They hide away in the plaza corner. My experience with them is not yet 5 stars. It is about 4.5 stats. 

The restaurant has good Thai food. I was here with a friend. He got the dish not in the menu and not serve to the public. This dish is call Kapoon. It is noodle dish with intestinal, pig stomach, and many other ingredients. This is actually a Laos dish. You only have to be lucky enough to enjoy it. 

I got a dish from the menu. I have shrimp in garlic sauce. It is a good sauce. The shrimp come in 7 total quantity. They are large. The entire dish is only $11 for the dinner price. Not bad at all. I also got a dish to go. The drunken noodles with shrimp. Again, the chef has a very good wok technique. Burn on the edge and maintain the wok high BTU oil burn technique. Love it. 

My friend got the sticky rice with mango. This dish top with sesame seed and coconut milk. Look very good. I would give them the credit for good dish in reasonable price. Come and enjoy them.

This is 4.5 stars in my book. When I was first here for the next door restaurant and notice them. That time they still working on the building interior. Now seeing them doing well, it is encouraging business in Brandon. There will be wait if you are not there early. I was there on Sunday ahead the church crowd. There is already 20 minutes wait. We take the breakfast bar without wait. 

We have the Dakota - it is flat iron steak with bread, toast and a side. I got the grit. The steak is delicious with the right seasoning. Steak was cook well and compliment to the chef skill. We also got the churro waffle. This dish come with 4 quarter pieces waffle with whip cream and caramel syrup. The waffle is crispy. A bit oily but is tasty. Very unique dish. 

I saw many dish fly out the serving window. The quantity of the food and presentation of the food was really nice. Service is attentive. It is step of right direction for the new restaurant.

It is about 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars. This restaurant in my bookmark for a while. We finally make it here to try the restaurant. This restaurant is kind east meet west. They have Laos food, southeast Asian, Asian, Italian, Americans cuisine. I like the ideal of variety. 

My wife have the grilled chicken with pasta. The chicken is marinated in satay sauce. It is a interesting combination with the Italian pasta. The chicken is well marinated into the meat. Great flavors. 

My dish is the New Zealand Lamb chop with red wine mushroom sauce. It serve over asparagus fried rice. Another west meet east cuisine. The lamb chop is well cook and soft to bite. Mushroom sauce is nice to be add on. 

The service is perfect, waiter is well train. Know the customer need and respond quickly. We have great time here.

Authentic Cuisine No 66. Mexican cuisine. 

It you don't mind hole in the wall setting, this can be your place. This restaurant is driven by good pricing and authentic Mexican food. If you want Street food, this may be your place. The restaurant is located at gas station plaza. It has limited seating. The food is delicious.

We have the Birria Taco. It is overnight taco meat. Sound not attractive. But after the meat cook overnight, the marinated spice in it. Add the cheese, it is good to have. Very fulfilling. It come with a soup that I have never have before. I wonder what is that. Before the meal, they have the flautas chip with salsa. It is delicious. We also got the ceviche taco, buche and campacheno taco. The buche is pig stomach and the campacheno is the mixed of steak, chicken and pork taco. Very interesting. 

Service is ok. The Mangonadas is great. It is a interesting street food.

#600th review

I choose Thuy Cafe because it is a small business with cool food. I would said Pinellas Park area have too many good Vietnamese food. This is one of the unique noodles soup area. It is tiny not too many seats. But we were able to get a seat at the weekend after the Love of Tango. 

I try their Bun Rieu Cua - Crab Cake Noodle Soup. This noodle soup have white crab cake, fried crab cake. Very nice soup base. The accompanying veggie is very well decorated with arrangement. This is my first time to have this soup. I have empty the whole bowl. 

We also have other items such as the lemongrass grilled beef sandwich, wonton noodle soup, shrimp chip. By the way, they have 20 different sandwich to try. Some include vegetarian ham. Ham for vegetarians???!!!

Pinellas, you don't know you have pearl in your area. Please check them up.

Finally New Tampa has it own assembly chain open up. To me it is 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars. They 4.5 stars due to their creativity of sauce. We have try their vinaigrette cilantros sauce and we like it. We also try their ginger citrus and coconut sweet potatoes sauce. I can said the sauce went through good R&D. 

A few thing they can improve are the BBQ chicken and steak. I feel their steak do not worth for the upgrade unless I can order the medium rare steak and chop up. Steak is over done. However I have to tip my hat to the teriyaki chicken and spicy tuna. Their Brussels sprouts, mushroom and broccoli are favorable to add on. The base I would recommend the forbidden rice, noodle and cauliflower rice. 

One other thing can improve on is to fill up the bowl. Don't let it 80% full.

The event is Holiday Light in the Garden for the fund raising for the Garden. Donations of $4 per adult is suggested for the fund raising. This lightning is in the Florida Botanical Garden. It cover quite a ground in the garden. It will require 1 hour to complete. 

The event include different theme on each section. I have seen the rose garden, the Cupid love garden, butterflies garden, ginger bread cookies garden, flamingo garden. Go find out yourself and get lost in the garden. 

The event has live music singing on the holiday theme. Santa station for pictures, snack station, chu chu train station display the toy train and more. The whole garden is pleasant to walk in the cool temperatures. Please remember which entrance you come into the garden. So go explore and enjoy a hot coco if too cold.

This is memorable night from The International Culinary School at The Art Institute of Tampa. This dinner no doubt is one of the best in the Bay now. The cost is low, the food is great, and we even get Chef Treatment. Tonight dinner is one that closer to my heart. The restaurant or the institute is naming as Tutored Chef and they only serves dinner on Thursday and Friday night from 6 pm to 8 pm. Please call 813-393-5395 for reservation.

The menu has ten items to select. Each item not more than $6.95. You also can try their special combination of the ten items from the menu with three to five course meals. The three courses is $13.95, four courses is $15.95, and five courses is $17.95. This is a steal and price buzzer. They are currently serving the spring menu. The summer menu will be start at July. I would encourage the patron go to support them. However, if you want to get the best cooking skill, come after four to six week later when they are familiar with their menu. That is when the food is goooooood. The food and the tip are going to the school. You can tip extra with cash and mention it is for the people who serve you. It is good for the student who serves you. 

Tonight we have everything in the menu. The restaurant starts with crouton with herb dip and enhance flavor butter. Then follow by baked empanada with passion fruit and Cajun Spice for opening. We started with grilled asparagus in asparagus puree and bacon bit. This is a well presented dish and it is elegantly presented. The asparagus is well cook and go well with the Canadian type bacon. The second initial entrée is the Egg - it is soft broil fried egg serve over the Mushroom Ragout. When the egg is cut, the egg yolk is spilled over the mushroom. The mushroom is cook with wine sauce. When it mixed with the egg yolk, it has added the flavor. The egg is fried with crust and tasty to eat. The third initial dish is the soup du Jour. The soup is one of the student creations. Creamy soup is served with smoke bacon. 

The main dish starts with the lamb - Chilled Grilled Leg of Lamb serve over the Israeli Couscous. It also has the touch of the Chimichurri sauce that makes the grilled lamb more desirable. The second main dish is shrimp - The shrimp is cook with Tarragon Tomato Relish and Chive Oil. It serves over the risotto. The taste is like old bay seasoning for the Maryland Crab. It goes well with the risotto. The third main dish is pork - They are two type pork is served here. Braise Smoked Pork Shanks and Sautéed Pork Tenderloin.  These are two different type of preparation. And both are good. It also serves with Potato Gratin, Baby Carrot, and snow peas. It is a balance meal. The fourth main dish is the beef - Slice Grilled Beef is place on top of the crouton and place on top of sweet Onion Marmalade. The onion is sautéed to soft and good for the mixed with the beef.

We close the night with Blueberry financier on blueberry sorbet and blueberry compote. It is pretty muffin cake over blue berry ice cream and syrup. We also have the Chocolate Marquis top with Ice Cream and roasted pistachios. Chocolate is same as mousse. 

I was going to post this review for my 200 hundred reviews. But restaurant this good needs to be shared. I am thinking do a UYE on the end of July or begin of the august when the student chefs get familiar with the summer menu.

Cool Aussie restaurant. This may be the first one mom and pop restaurant in New Tampa. Saturday they have karaoke night. Friday live music. Tuesday half price wing. Thursday prime rib. Wednesday trivia night. 

Their famous item is the meat pie and the sausage. But this two items they are wipe out by take out order. So we go for the Thai beef mango wrap and the fish and chip. The mango wrap is excellent. Good quality of chop beef in square. The sauce accompanying the wrap very well. The fish and chip is excellent. Very comparable to English versions. The fish is Australian sea bass. Good white fish. 

I will be back for their prime rib and meat pie. So far I have good experiences with restaurant. We also got the chicken wombat wings to go. It is great wings.

It is a cute restaurant serving lunch and breakfast. Parking can be challenging if there is studio sessions next door. Even at regular weekends, the parking is full. They do have outdoor seating area if you bring the pet. 

There is must try drink in restaurant. The horchata iced coffee is a must have. I like it for cooling summer hot day. We got two different flans. The salted caramel and the butterscotch flan. Both flans are delicious. We also got the Timba with guava dipping. The Timba is the fried cheese - Queso Blanco. This fried cheese and great to have. 

The restaurant have many sandwiches. We were here after lunch for dessert. Food ordering was easy.

Kay's Kitchen has new place. I use to go to their old place which only order from the window. The current location has improved a lot. The improvement are as below. They has seating area for the customers if they decide to dine in. At old location many customers order and eat at the car. Second, the food preparation time cut to half. Old kitchen need a long wait if customers in front of you. 

We track down their new restaurant location and finally we have a visit. Before you visit, you need know a few thing. First they cook the food when you order. They are not like other fast food fried the chicken and sit on the rack until customers order it. As a result the food is fresh and delicious. So, you need some patience to wait for them to cook your food. But you can order ahead by phone to cut down your wait time. Second, if you dine in, you need to wear non expensive clothing, because the food smell will stick on you. No leather accessories because it will stick at the leather and difficult to remove. 

I like Kay's chicken because they prepare it fresh. They use light coating not like other fast food have thick coating that you cannot feel the chicken. Their chicken is Chicago style which is rare in Tampa Bay Area. So go get your own.

I was looking for something like boba drinks in at ample Terrace, however, there was none close by at Busch Blvd. so I look for juice nearby, the Frappe show up. I decided to give them a try while I wait for my sandwich to be made on other restaurant. 

I got the mixed tropical fruits smoothies. The owner explains to me if they add bananas, it will change the taste. Infect the good taste. So I have it without bananas. I like the taste. Not only the quantity is there, taste is there, fruit is good, coooool off summer heat. 

This place is a good option to have healthy drink as a meal. It does fill you up. The place is empty during lunch. I would recommend you to visit here. It will be worth a trip and get your money worth. So go cool off from summer heat.

Rare Ethnic Food 7

This is an annual get together Ramadan experience at a restaurant of choosing. This will be our second annual Ramadan buffet with the Yelp friends. Usually the buffet start at sundown which is 8:30 pm. Petra was choose for this year Ramadan buffet of the night. If the Yelper want to actually experience it just fast for one day and join the dinner buffet is more meaningful. 

Petra put out a good feast. Total cost with tip and tax is about $20. It includes the drink, the buffet and the desserts. Yummy. Tonight we have the Lamb, grill chicken, fried fish, pita, three type of hummus, falafel, grape leave, lentil soup, Greek salad, and more. The lamb display is awesome. Feel like eating a horse, this will be the feast. The desert is great. Plenty to go around.

In this holy month, many has come to enjoy the buffet. The food is very good and a lot of choices. The drink include mint lemonade that very unique. I would join their buffet before is over. The feast is 4.5 stars.

It is about 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars. This is the third revolution ice cream I been to. This one have a lot of space. They always carry good ice cream. Sometimes I think they are too creative on the name that I could not figure out what is the really the ice cream flavor. 

Today I have the porky and the banana pudding. The porky is the vanilla ice cream with bacon. The ice cream is great. The bacon is good. The banana pudding is the one I like among the two. 

They do have taste try. My wife always ask me why you buy the one that I did not try. I said to her I already try all other flavor definitely buy the one I did not try.

I like the new concept of this place. This is a place I going to revisit. This first pick your own ingredients pizza place. It is build your own. First choose the dough. You can have white, wheat, gluten free or Keto friendly crust. I am going for the wheat dough. The guy who made it very skill. He stretched and throws to the air spinning with further stretching to thin crust. It is a show. 

Then you chose your sauce. You don't need to choose one sauce. I got the extra virgin olive oil then ask them to add the basil pesto. This is the first time I see pizza using basil pesto sauce. Unique. Next step is type of cheese. I am going to mozzarellas. Then the veggies, I pick the mushroom, sundry tomatoes, minced garlic, basil leaves, jalapeño and olive. First time also I see pizza add garlic. Then the meat. I got the sausage, pepperoni, meat ball, salami. That complete my master piece. 

I also ask them to top with balsamic drizzle. Love it. I don't eat a lot of pizza. But I would recommend this pizza. You can add the combo with drink and chip of gelato or salad.

The remote restaurant is rest at the middle of the rural area. Who can think this place is good and affordable in price. We were attract to the recent post in the talk by Nick S. for the highly decorate 5 star restaurant. We have to check this out tonight. The whole street is dark at that area except this restaurant. People line out at this place before their turn to order. The store front is small and we have a suspicious this is good?

The restaurant look like a hipster place. The setup is efficient  allow the patron to order and they give you a code to pick up the food. The sitting area is limited. They have some table at the outside of the building. Today we have the Austinite taco, west coast taco, and the Texas flood taco. This is translated as Carne Asada Beef, grilled shrimp, and beef brisket. All meat is grilled to perfection. The Austinite came with caramelized onion and avocado. The Texas Flood has the chipotle BBQ sauce. The meat is grilled and have a lot flavor. The beef and shrimp is marinated. 

All taco is $4.25, the burrito is $9.50, wet buritto is $10.25 and bowl is $9.25. You can order each combination at above package. The salsa of the chip is great. This place is affordable for the price, good quality food, perfect seasoning and flavor. As a result I have give them 5 star for the so little price we pay. The biggest price is to pay the gas to get there.

I can said this place is a potential restaurant for UYE or YUM. This restaurant have all the components that it needs to be great restaurant. The cuisine are Cuban and Ecuador for selection. Food is delicious here. 

This place do not have the fancy setup but a caliente welcoming for the person who craving for good food. Food here is killer good. Encebollado de Pescado. This is an Ecuador seafood soup dish. It has the tuna in lemon base soup and onion. The onion take the edge of the sourness of the lemon. It come with green plantains. It is very flavorful. 

The next dish we have is Lechon Asado. This is roasted pork leg with mojo flavor. This is an amazing dish when they got it right. The meat is juicy and the skin full of flavor. This disk accompanied with arroz Moro. Arroz Moro is black bean fried rice. It is the best one I have with mix of black bean. 

Other than the main entrée, they have sandwiches, fresh juice or shake, appetizers and sides.  I have the fresh Mamey juice. This is the only place I know have this juice.

This is the Volvo dealer I have my car service and buy the next car. I have to drive 45 minutes to this dealer if I want my car service. It is far from my home but why I like them. The service here is great compare to all other service that I have received from different dealer. I have been to Toyota, Mazda, Ford, Honda dealer but none have come close to the service here. 

The good thing of the dealer is by appointment and makes your life easier. I always get the free loaner car (newer model Volvo) from them while I have my car service. After the service, they have my car wash and vacuum. It is a treatment. Every time close to my service, I receive the coupon of 15% discount. They are very proactive. Another good thing is Volvo is made such that service only need to be done every 7500 mile compare to most car is done at 3000 mile. Each year I only need 2 services for each year. 

I bought my next car replacement here also. I waited for the internet special for the pre-own car sales. I normally buy the second hand car less than 30,000 miles and less than 2 years old. With the internet special, I got my car 50% from original MSRP price. Good price. I paid only $20,000. I always paid for additional manufacturer bumper to bumper cover up to 7 years and 100,000 miles. It only cost $1600 for this cover. As a result I bought a car that has more coverage (30,000 mile additional cover) than most cars. It has the luxury package such as BLIS, leather seat, moon roof, rear seat climate, road hazard and more. I believe they are general better than buying a new car. You can check their car fax with no accident.

Now they have the eco boast car that is gasoline with 37 mpg. Please check them out. The other Volvo dealer may not offer the same even they are in Bay Area.

This is one of the old running restaurants close to 100 years old. It has been an honor and part of the history to dine in this restaurant. We have made the reservation through the YELP App that through the open table. When we arrive our reservation is in place and we we're sit immediately. I like the reservation system in YELP.

Tonight we have order the Escargots En Casserole, Oysters Arnaud, Turtle Soup, Pompano David and Assorted Green. The first course is the Escargots En Casserole. The dish comes with six mini cup of escargots top with mini croissant. Each ceramic cup has the garlic herb and Pernod. I like to take out the pastry and dip in the garlic herb and top with the snail. It is good. The second course is the Oysters Arnaud. It bears the name of the restaurant due to the famous five pieces oyster prepare in five different ways. The first piece of the half shell prepare with shrimp, mushroom, green onion, herb and season in white wine sauce. The second piece is top with bacon, pimento, green onion and pepper. The third piece is top with artichoke hearts, garlic, fresh Parmigiano Reggiano and in the extra-virgin olive oil. The four piece is essence of Creole in eggplant and andouille sausage. The final piece is actually the Oyster Rockefeller with spinach and bacon and a touch of Pernod. These five pieces are great to eat experience the taste around the world. Got to have them when you visit the restaurant!!

Our main course starts with turtle soup. This is unique dish that serve by many plantation near New Orleans. It has the game meat of the snapping turtle. It prepare in Creole sauce at tomato base. Our Assorted Green includes the hearts of Palm, butter lettuces, Arugula, Raddicchio and top with the duck crump crackling. It is serves with the Creole Mustard Vinaigrette dressing. Yum !! Pompano David is the fish that grilled with skin on fillet. It brushed with extra-virgin olive, lemon, garlic and fresh herb. The waitress was nice enough to split the order to two for the fish and green for each of us. 

We have closed our night with a dessert The Banana Foster for two. The waiter will cook this dish in front of you. They start melt the butter, then they added the cinnamon and brown sugar and make the brown sauce. The exciting park is they flamed at table side with banana liqueur and dark rum. Banana is added to the sauce to cook and serve over the French Vanilla ice cream. This has end the evening perfectly. The waiter and waitress have an excellent service. They are quick to act and pick up the crump on the table. I have never seen a service like this. I would award six stars.

The up stair of the restaurant display the historic dresses from Mardi Gras at the pass. Please do not miss this opportunity if you visit this restaurant. They are locate at the stair next to the restroom up floor.

This food truck was at my eye sight for some time. I drove pass it for many time at that location and saw bright light next to the gas station. I have been here one late night but they close. Today was the perfect day to try. 

I would say they are the best taco in USF area. It is number two best in my list. We have order the lengua, tripa, asada, al pastor. I love the lengua and tripa. They are good flavor. The steak (Asada) was well seasoning, I like their way burn the steak a bit to bring out the aroma of the steak. The pastor has deep seasoning. Most of the taco place only lightly seasoning not bring out the good of the taco. Here did a good job. 

On my next return, I will surely try the Cabeza, chorizo, chicharon, and carnitas. Food is reasonable price. You can call the number to place your order ahead and pickup without waiting. They are fluent in English. Since it is affordable, I am not paid your taco.

Waffle, Fried Chicken, and Bacon. Great combination!!  How was the bacon was done. It hide between the waffle. The bacon are all pan seared to crispy then mixed between layer of waffle. It becomes waffle bacon. Amazing concept. 

I have the trip RyRy Triple Threat waffle chicken and the Korean wings. The triple threat comes with three different RyRy signature chicken. The original, southern, and Korean chicken. These chicken pieces from the chicken breast and make in three different flavor. I like all of them with variety in one order. It also come with choices of syrup. I got the sriracha syrup with some spiciness in the taste. Great combination. 

The Korean wing I have it non breaded. You can have the option to breaded the wings. The Korean sauce on the wings is great. It has tiny ginger in the sauce and make it sophisticated. All orders need to be waited. Table is limited if you decide to eat there.

For weekday lunch. The selection is great. You also can make your own pasta. Choose the pasta type, choose the protein, and choose the sauce. I can said that they have great chef technique. It won't be able to go wrong. 

The lunch special is less than half of the dinner price. It great for the business people have lunch here with quick order and get out in 40 minutes. Food is extremely good. You are paid more than value, great food and great flavor. 

We have chef Complimentary tomato sauce over toasted bread. Our entree are Grouper Rosso and Prosciutto Linguine. Both dishes are excellent. The Grouper Rosso grouper is blackened over fettuccine. The fettuccine is serve on creamy basil tomato sauce. It includes the mushroom and scallions. Great combination. 

The best dish is the Prosciutto Linguine. The Prosciutto and the fried garlic make great combination. The Prosciutto release the cure meat flavor into the dish make this dish desirable. Lovely dish.

Review # 2700, this review milestone go to Local Italian Restaurant to recognize their new efforts during pandemic. 

The restaurant take over previous Italian restaurant which has been here for some time. The new owner creates the attractive menu. What you need to ask is their special. They do have separate chef special seafood items of the night other than the menu. I also like the bigger dining room with compare to old restaurants. The ventilation also improved from old setup. 

We start the night with the fried calamari. The coating has a special flavor with seasoning. The dipping marinara sauce is fresh and different. I love it. Ingredients must be good condition to have the good sauce. 

My wife have the chicken parmigiana with spaghettini with pink sauce. The chicken is breaded with marinated coating. It was crispy and tasty with cheese and marinara sauce. The pink sauce also interesting. My dish is a signature of the restaurant. I have the sacchettini with added grilled shrimp. This is the first time I try sacchettini. It is dumping stuff with pear and mozzarella. Then it cook in Gorgonzola Sauce. It is heavenly good. Highly recommend this dish if you have never have this Italian dish before. 

Overall the service and food is good. A VERY excellent Italian Restaurant. Please ask if you can bring your own wine.

Awesome display. The lego artist Nathan Sawaya has creations that drawn many to see. He is lawyer with free time to expressing himself in the aft form. Many pieces that were displayed are very creative. This exhibition was sponsored by Vinik Family Foundation. A big thank to them to bring such a caliber artist to the city. 

The art not just mimic the ancient famous paintings, it has our daily life movement in 2D or 3D art format. In fact, some of the art cannot even tell it is made from lego after you have snap the photo of those creation. The photo just look real. I like the eye position art, in some angle you could not see it but other angle completely show up with surprising picture. 

The photographer superimposed with lego art is awesome with pictures. It is out of the world. It has the beauty for the right things. Such as a man using the lego umbrella in the rain, a lady in front of the ticket box office with her dress disintegrated. 

Tip - go there every month since they swap out the art time to time. The art will be displayed for 3 months. Seem like each month they change out a few pieces. Weekend expect long line. There is parking at the entrance under the bridge.

Rene is one of the great food truck in Tampa. For the Taco Truck, they are at top of my list. Great food and creative. Now they are located next to across Southern brewery empty lot area. You may want to call ahead before your visit to see if they open. They were at Dale Mabry before. The current location is more permanent. 

We have three different taco to try. We have the Chile Relleno, Carne Asada, Pork Barbacoa. The one taco that very interesting and recommended is the Chile Relleno. This jalapeño stuffed ground beef and fried. This is the first time I have taco this way. The carne Asada was delicious compared to many steak taco.

Overall the taco are excellent. Flavor is definitely good. They also have other type like grilled butter squash, pork belly, steak bacon, spicy shrimp and oyster mushroom. These menu is great and think out of box.

Authentic Ethnic Street Food 72. Shawarma 

Interesting street food that now I can said happen in Tampa. Very good authentic shawarma. I have travel to Jordan, UAE, Morocco, and Egypt, this shawarma is very close to the way Jordan has prepared. 

We got one beef and one chicken shawarma. If you want extra meat, you can have a choice to choose a different price. The wrap skin is very delicious. Recommend to eat there to get full experience. If you have to eat at the car, do so. Eat at first complete prepared is the key.

Excellent service, food and good atmosphere. This Noble Crust was strategic located in Carrollwood area. The selection of the plaza for this restaurant is perfect. In this plaza, they are the only restaurant. Which mean perfect for parking spot since no other restaurant compete for car parking during the night. I can easily find a space to park in compare to many other restaurant which I have circular the area for parking. 

The place in trendy. I like the modern decoration. 

Service: the waitress know how to compliment the dress or shoes of the customers make lady customers feel they did the right thing. This added pleasures does go a long way. 

QC: I have observed the kitchen head chef QC every dish come out. This make the consistency of the food. I would said that is a big step to make sure the food come out correctly. 

Kitchen: the new Noble Crust does have full equip big kitchen. It make all the food fly out without too much to wait. This is the reason why they are successful in this location. 

Food: we have the bistro steak, FGBLT, and the PEI mussel. The steak is cook to the temperature we have asked. It is good size of steak. It top over collars green with southern twist. The accompanying mash potato top with drizzle balsamic vinegar and green aioli. I like the steak top with green apple chimichuri. Very unique. The FGBLT is lay the fried green tomato as a base and layer with pimento cheese. Final touch top with glazed pork belly. The presentation is very nice. However the pork belly harmony is not there. I would said they need to work on the skin fat and meat combination. It need to be melt at your tongue instead a very chewy piece. I like the PEI mussel. It is cook with saffron broth. Most of the mussel I have either butter wine sauce or tomato red sauce. I like the way they have it with the southern twist with added andouille sausage. 

Overall, they are very good job with competitive price. It make me to revisit. Truly 5 stars restaurant with the right price. Not perfect. But close enough.

I like the different style of food is being served in Tampa. This fruit juice bar is one of the kind. It is part of Columbian daily street fruit juice. There two Columbia Mango I know off. This is one of them. I like this one better because they able to customize the drinks and fruit you want. In compare to boba drinks, this mango mix fruit juice combo is more naturally done. It is healthy. 

I got mango mixed and custom myself. I have mango noodle, mango leche, condensed milk and ice cream. Very nice. I ask them to prepare in the sweeten side. You can ask for sour drinks. The mango leche is from green mango frozen into drinks. Very refreshing. I also ask them pick the sweet mango which is great combo. 

The service is great here. The people who do mixer are very friendly. I will be back to experience their other fruit combo.

It is actually 4.5 stars rating. Since no half stars round up to 5. Shave ice with flavor is originated from Taiwan. I like the store did create some new and it is their own way. The shaved ice is smooth with nice design. Love the interior with dine in partition separation. 

We start with charcoal waffle with two choices of topping. I like this one to try. The charcoal waffle is unique. Our topping is the ice cream and the egg pudding. It is item to share.
