This dish is chicken marinated in sake and soy sauce then deep fried with coating. They are quite good. The accompanying slaw also good. What a treat. It come with 5 big pieces chicken. 

The order to wait for the food is less than 5 minutes. They have enough man power for the food preparation.

It is about 4.5 stars in my book. It does bring something fresh to the community. Is it an art, ice cream, or beautiful treat? All of that. 

They have the gelato and ice cream section. I would go to the gelato because they are more interesting. We taste many flavor. I got the banana foster and bourbon gelato. This two flavors is excellent taste and not find elsewhere. Then you can choose the type of make up or just regular cone. For the experience, I would go for the makeup cone they have. We got the clown cone. This is with cotton candy. We take a part and eat those separately. 

By the way, extra scoop is only a dollar more. The clown cone is $7 and extra scoop make it to the $8. Not cheap, but they give good quantity of gelato to make up the price.

I like my time here. I would say this not a true 5 stars restaurant but very close to 4.5 stars. The place is cute. Two dining rooms setting. I was not going to have the high expectations. They have very good lunch special Monday to Friday. Approximately $9. Great deal. 

I did not go for the lunch special and go straight to one of their best dish. The cuisine is very similar to Black Forrest Germany cuisine when I have visited the Germany. I got the Schweinshax'n (pork Shank). It come with sauerkraut and bread dumplings. The sauerkraut was excellent. The dumplings is interesting that come as a cake pieces. 

The shank is braise and over roasted. They have lite seasoning outwardly. It is a big chunk. Great for hungry people. The pork sauce is great accompanied the bread dumplings and the pork shank. 

While I visited there, many have order the lunch special. Definitely a go to menu for lunch.

It is about 4.5 stars for the food. You need to be patient because they need time to cook your order. Grilled meat need time to complete perfectly. If you don't want to wait, you can order ahead of time for pick up when you arrive. The wait is 20 minutes. 

We have the Tostones Gauchos with picanha. The tostone has to with cheese, salsa with fry berries. The picanha was grilled perfectly with the order. The seasoning is there. Tostone are very crisply fried. We also got the half pound combo with two sides. The protein we have selected is the Lomo de Cerdo. The pork was grilled correctly. Love it. The two side includes cord and garlic rice. The garlic rice was well prepared with garlic fragrance. 

Our experience here is perfect. Definitely recommend to revisit. Next time we want to try their Churrasco and other side.

Rare Ethnic Food No.12

This is the series of five rare ethnic food at every 100 review I have made. I have selected Byblos due to their unique decorations and the unique cuisine Lebanese Cuisine.

Middle Eastern food is alway heavy in spice, marinated technique, and grilled timing. Byblos has these technique in high standard. I have the lamb chop and my wife has a mixed grilled. The lamb is the bone in lamb that is well cut and perfectly grilled. The marinated spice is well deep into the meat. This dish is my favorite. My wife have the mixed grilled. They are good also. But after you have the lamb, you will feel the lamb is more superior than the sheik kabab. 

The room is well decorated. Each room has it own character. The outside sitting include fire pit you can grilled you own. The interior include formal dining hall, bar area, private drape room. 

The service is good during lunch time. The lunch is certainly more affordable, but the dinner portion is a lot larger.

One of the treasures in St. Louis at The Loop Neighborhood is this Chinese restaurant. It is great to visit them if you are in St. Louis. They have boba tea and hand pull noodle. My wife like their hand pull noodle. I also like the boba or smoothie. I like the mung bean smoothie.

We begin the handmade wonton in chili oil. This dish dumplings is great. Love the chili oil and the wonton skin. Our second dish is their special beet dry handmade pan-fried lamb and cilantro dumplings. Just the name you already know this dish is special. I have not seen anyone serve this dish before. Because of the beet, the dumplings look red. Very interesting. 

Our last dish is the Pepper Chitterlings. Great wok technique with soften chitterlings. Great dish to go with rice. I enjoy every bit. The service is great. The food come out quick. You can see the chef hand pull the noodle and make the dumplings.

My second visit is pleasant. This time I am sit down have snack at dinner. I believe they are 4.5 stars restaurant not full 5 stars. Although I didn't try their ninja chicken nuggets again, but we do try fried calamari and the the black garlic ramen. They finally have the token ramen with newest ramen dish. Black garlic is one of the kind. It has the black sesame oil with black garlic on it. It is delicious. The calamari was fried very good with good coating. 

The reason they are upgraded is I make a challenge to their boba team. I ask a drink that partial in the menu but not totally in the menu. They have winter Mellon milk tea. I ask if they can do the slush. They said they have not done that before. But they will try. End up it is good drink.

I like Sandra. It is about 4.5 stars. If you come here, I recommend to get at least one link of their homemade sausage. This item is must have. They do have a table on the outside and few table inside. 

They do have combo meal, sandwiches, dinner plate and more. If you really want to try everything, they have built your own by pound or pieces. I like the build your own because I can try everything - pull pork, brisket, rib, chicken, catfish, sausage, rib and sides. The rib, chicken and brisket are delicious. The sausage is the best. 

The price is moderate. It is worth the money because of the taste and experience. If you like southern BBQ, this is a good choice.

Rare Ethnic Food #71. Tunisian Sweet. 

It is about 4.5 stars. I were here several time and they close for irregular hour. And pandemic. Finally I got to visit their store and try something that rarely found in the Bay Area. Tunisian sweet is temptation delight for the Mediterranean people. It is a good item for for tea time and more. It a crazy good sweet food but not too sweet. 

We have several interesting look sweet that is my first time try it. This sweet includes Chaba Kia shape like honeycomb and taste like rose water. Makroudh with dates infill item. Youyou like small sweet donut.  Ghrayba Hommos with hazelnut. The best is the pistachio cake. They are quite famous for that. Must try. 

Overall the experience is good. I can see to get use to it. Definitely come back for some other items.

Cool park for the kid and adults. Waterworks Park attracts young and old. Many bring kid to enjoy this park. It even has a fence area for our four leg friend to roam free. 

The park is our current Tampa mayor Bob Buckhorn first completed city project. It is a combination of historic district development and current end of Tampa Riverwalk. The name match the intensity of the park. It has bunch of water elements playground for the kid to run through and big splash of the big bucket. As a adult, I think is is fun to do it too. 

The park has a very high profile of restaurant Ulele and Rotary Club Pavilion. The pavilion is an outdoor amphitheater. The Tampa Shakespeare Festival was held here. During the food truck event, the pavilion has live music.

The dessert is one of the kind in Tampa Bay Area. This is an nitrogen ice cream that I have never seen. It is different technique to freeze the liquid ice cream to final ice cream hardness. The use nitrogen liquid shot at the liquid ice cream with your flavor and ingredients add in. Then it frozen to what you want. 

First choose your size. Regular or Large. You also can go with waffles or donut cones. This cone is freshly make there. Then choose your based - coffee, vanilla, chocolate, cotton candy and etc. then choose your mixed in. I like the heat bar. 

We were here for their special donut cones. The cones is freshly baked. Then it cool with liquid nitrogen inwardly. The ice cream they make drop into the cone. It was great fun process to watch them make it. Next time I will try their waffles cone.

Old school restaurant. They don't take credit card. However, they take check or cash. They also have no web side. This is a 4.5 stars restaurant since they don't take cash. However the food is good consider the good time per the name of the restaurant. Yelp don't have 4.5 stars. 5 stars is rated. 

Food cost is in the high side. There is a value for the art of cooking. The sauce and culinary art is good. The meat is well prepared. Tonight we have dinner with friends and I have the New York Strip with special gravy sauce - spicy Madagascar green peppercorns sauce flame with cognac. It came with sautéed mushrooms, green bean, potatoes. The mushrooms is well cook and brown.

My wife have the duck with cherry sauce. This is their signature dish according to Nick grandma. The duck is well braise. I like it when the meat is separated from the bone easily. This dish accompanied with green bean and rice. Yum. 

Service is great. Next time I will have the beer since they brew it since 1292.

Best value for NOLA food. 

Many of the menu item is fried but they are wonderful to try. I guess they got their name Crispy because the crispy fried items. This place is in my book mark for some time. Nick first go to this place without me. Now I come with him for the redemption. 

Since this is our fourth restaurants to visit today, we order something good for munch. We have Cajun fried gizzards, crispy catfish, Orleans beignets, and seafood gumbo. The best is the gumbo. It has good taste here. If you are here, just order one without sharing. Have it all for yourself. 

I like the catfish and the gizzards. The catfish was nicely batter and fried. The gizzards is soft and easy to eat. This is special item that not serve in normal item to many restaurants. 

The owner of the restaurant is nice and she know her cuisine. If you are here your soul for seafood gumbo will be retained in this place. Good luck.

This restaurant has some characteristics on the Thai cuisine. If you like very authentic taste, this restaurant has some. We like it because the material use on the dish is unique.

We have order the Tropical duck and grouper special for our entrees. We have the winter shrimp as appetizer. The winter shrimp is a good value. Most of the restaurant has this dish with one shrimp and tail. This restaurant has the whole roll fill with shrimps. 

The tropical duck with the meat fried to crispy. It has tropical fruit such as pineapple and lychee. It make it interesting but not wow me. However, they are good enough dish. The dish that wow me is the special grouper. It has a root slice item and green string like the lemon grass flavor. I couldn't make up the name of the two items. But they just make this dish so unique. 

I like the food of this store. Service is average.

It is my honor to introduce you the small business sandwich shop that is one of the top of my list. 

I have read many reviews for this shop and learn about the abbreviation of SSSS for name this shop. You also can said it translated to Sophisticate, Satisfaction, Special and Stylish sandwich. This four words are truly represent the food serve there.

We are trying their new sandwich that is not in the menu yet. We have the Arcade. It is quarter pound seared Ahi Tuna on the pretzel bun. The tuna is well seared on the out side with toasted sesame seed. The sesame seed was prepared very nicely with crispy and crunchy. It top with marinated sea weed salad and sriracha mayo. This sandwich is a keeper can be considered in the regular menu. Very sophisticate and special. It also come with a choice of side for $10.99. 

It you visit the shop, you will see the took picks on the ceiling. These took picks are the left over from sandwich. It becomes a transitional for this store. Service is friendly, food is good, price is right. They deserve to be 5 stars.

The event is a success in the food court. A lot credit go to the organizer. This night, I believe over 300 people show up. They over 6 food truck there today. I wish it could have been more. The Asian cuisine is popular to the local. 

The food truck include 2 Filipino trucks, one Thai truck, Korean, dumpling truck. All food is great if you order their specialty. The atmosphere is great. I have been to the first Friday event and not truck show up. But this is something for the taste of Asia. We have big group of yelpers show up and support this event. Thanks to Carlos Eat who are helping in this event. 

Our group share the food across table. Food, drink and great time make up for the night. I would recommend come here for thier special truck event.

Hyde Park Village is almost like small community in the Bay Area that actually separate from the rest of America. You will not need to get out of village and you can get everything there. 

Imagine that they 3 garages you can park your car. The businesses include Brooks Brothers, Tommy Bahama, papers store, dog toy, clothing, jewelry. There is a Bridal store for designer gown. 

You also can become a member for the LA fitness for exercise. The village has the fresh market that you can get your groceries there. A lot to offer. 

The restaurants in the village have great selection. It includes the wine bistro, Italian chop house, quick snack with creative taco and pastry store for breakfast. There is a "nature table" for quick bite. 

All the stores or restaurants are in 5 minutes walking distance. There are some apartments or house surrounding the village.

This is a USF center for advance health care state of the art building that receive patient. The parking garage is convenient connected next to center and has designated patient parking. The building is connected with sky bridge at second floor that allow pedestrian crossing over the street in cover over top. The state of art building cost USF $67 million to build. This is wold class building with intend for patient and learning center. This is not the USF medical school department where student having classes. 

The center allows patient to consult with the specialty doctor. Specialties include: Orthopedics and Sports Medicine; Physical Therapy, Ear, Nose and Throat, Breast Health, Women's Health, Neurology, and Dermatology and Cutaneous Surgery. It has ambulatory surgery center with eight operating rooms and five endoscopy suites.  It also has diagnostic imaging center with MRI, CT, women's diagnostics with mammography, ultrasound and bone densitometry, fluoroscopy, basic X-ray, and nuclear medicine. 

It has cafeteria and drug store Sweetbay Pharmacy conveniently located on the 1st floor. Great customer service. Occasionally you have to wait for the doctor if they have emergency case.

We have a chance to visit one of the specialty doctor here. The reception is super nice since they have to care for the internal illness patient. The doctor we see is knowledgeable on their medical back ground.

I come to Twennie home town but she has not review this place yet. I am surprised that I am reviewing ahead of her. 

The Tasty Pho is a very comfortable place to be compared to many Vietnamese restaurant in the Bay Area. Modern looking interior decoration and nice to eat and hangout. I forgot to ask if they have the Wifi. 

I have order the combination Tasty Beef Noodle pho and grilled shrimp sub Banh Mi Tom Nuong. The Tasty Beef Noodle is combination of slice beef, beef flank, beef ball, beef tripe and beef tendon. I like this noodle soup due to the tripe and tendon are big and whole piece. The soup has a bit of minty taste. The grill shrimp sub is sub is best one I have. The shrimp is include a bit black pepper and they are grill to perfection. The bun is toasted and crispy. Therefore they are easy to bite. 

Overall the experience is great. Like the pho and Banh Mi. Services is great and the interior is great.

The word for this restaurant is NOLA cuisine. This restaurant simply the best in Tampa Bay Area for serving the NOLA cuisine. We love our time here. The service is a bit slow. But the food are excellent. This place has vibe. If you come before 11:00 am order a drink, the beignets is free go with the drink. 

I like bar area. It has tight cool bar. This is a tiny place. The most you can seat inside is less than 40. Time to time they are pack. We have ordered beignets, Andouille Sausage, Red Grouper Bite, and the Seafood Gumbo. The beignets is just ok. But the rest of food are delicious. The red grouper is fresh and chunky. It accompanied with red cabbage slaw and sweet potatoes. This come with 4 different sauce. Yummy to try. 

The Andouille Sausage is slice into 4 thin slice. Serves over red bean and Louisiana style rice. The red bean was grind to liquid and serve with whole bean. The sausage is pan grilled to let the taste exhaust outwardly. The seafood gumbo is insanely good. It has shrimp, scallops, Andouille Sausage, crab, grouper, okra, pea. The gumbo sauce take you out of your mind. If someone looking for Louisiana cuisine, I will certainly point this way. 

Too good. So try yourself. Mike drop experience.

For the lunch, they deserve the five stars. This is about 4.5 stars restaurant. This restaurant is new kid at the block at this southern Riverview. Restaurant location at Apple map is incorrect and I have reported them. The Yelp page was correctly show the restaurant location. 

If you looking for value lunch, this is the place. I have their lunch special with maki lunch. The cost is $9. Two rolls with a choice of soup or salad. I got the spicy tuna and and salmon skin rolls. Both rolls come at 8 pieces. They are good size. I hope they keep it up. 

I also go an app Mixed Tempura. It come with two tempura shrimp, four tempura veggies and one tempura broccoli. They have the best broccoli tempura which not over coating the broccoli. Very good technique. The dipping sauce bowl is big enough to accommodate the tempura pieces. Shrimp is great. 

I don't need to wait for my food. I finish in less than 35 minutes for lunch. Good value entree and app for $15.

Mad scientist or creative chef. Do you have to decide the final outcome for the food lab. It is actually experiment food?  Mmmm. Let see the dinner out come. We have our company holiday dinner there with design menu. It is not cheap but very worth for the trip. 

Our request menu is a four course night with starting the cold appetizers at the first plate. My wife have the almond coconut gazpacho - it is coconut rock shrimp with Fuji Apple salpicon in green curry oil. This a cold soup. The rock shrimp is nice and creative in the soup. The soup base is not normal gazpacho and is white. It is good. I have the avocado leaf seated yellow fin tuna. This is the best of the cold app. It come green mango salad, aji amarillo sorbet, fish sauce caramel and tamarind peanut crunch. It creative that the sorbet replace the wasabi and the fish sauce caramel replace the balsamic reduction sauce. Now you know why they call themselves food lab. 

The second course are the hot appetizers. I have smoked maple glazed pork belly. It top with hoe cake, black eyed peas, green tomato chow-chow. Usually I don't care about hoe cake but sauce and other ingredients combine, it is great. The pork belly is cook perfectly. If you are not good chef, do not try this dish because it need three part meat harmony. My wife has Serrano ham zeppole. The slice hams were place on top of rosemary doughnuts with compressed melon, Saba and Parmesan snow. Interesting dish. The rosemary was deep fried to crispy with seasoning. I have not have it this way before. 

Our third course are the main dishes. I have the red snapper a la plancha. It is fillets snapper with sautéed and glazed on top on avocado coconut grits, baby spinach, mergers marmalade, avocado chutney and mango harissa purée. This best main dish tonight the purée go very well with the fish. My wife has the painted hills short rib 'sancocho'. Usually the Caribbean sancocho is a mix of meat and veggies soup. This is an overhaul design for the short rib with boniato, yuca, sweet potato, and sweet corn, green plantain,avocado toss watercress, and cilantro sweet garlic juice. I only can said - it is good. 

The final course is the sugar crusted butter cake or chocolate peanut butter bar. Both of them is great. I the butter cake because the cake form the caramelized sugar crust on all expose wall. The cake is syrup and is good. 

The only thing is the food take a bit time to come out for the first dish. The rest are good. The service is great. The drink you have to refer to the pic since we don't know what they have created.

This restaurant locate at downtown St. Pete close to the museum of fine art. Since this is a Thursday night with museum special deal after 5 pm ($5 per adult, normal $17), after museum, we decide to come to this restaurant. 

The store front is a open bar. The time we were there is about six and they can sit you immediately. After 30 minutes, there is already a waiting line. Please come before six if you don't want to wait for sit. Bella already extend their sitting area with capacity, however if you are late, you will need to wait.  Among all the restaurant at downtown, they are the most reason in price for the food. 

Today I order the menu with "secondi" category - marinated skirt steak and my wife order the grilled chicken pasta. The item in the "secondi" came with soup of the day or salad. This is better deal. The $22 skirt steak came with two side and a soup. Good deal. The soup of the day is minestrone sausage soup. It is bean base, dice tomatoes, dice carrot, and chop pasta in crush tomatoes base. I believe they have added the oregano and basil to enhance the flavor. It make the soup well balance and interesting. 

The skirt steak is marinated with sweet sauce and serve with mash potatoes and grill broccolini. The broccolini is very impress. They broil, grill and stir fry in the process with garlic sauce with a hint of spicy chili. This make the food sophisticate. The skirt steak is grill to your order and slice to the bite size. 

The whole proceed of serving is ok. It is slow in the beginning but it pick up at the end. The extend area may be good for company Christmas party. It deserve for full stars due to to chef cooking skill, service, clean bath room and good pricing.

Best of the Tampa Bay have many vendors display in one time. The different between the VIP and Regular ticket is the sitting. The VIP has assign sitting and the regular are fighting for the park bench of stair case. Event this big will take two hours to complete the tour for entire vendors. This event is sold out. I have the chance to party with my friend Nick throughout the walk of fame. We also meet up with Rachel, Fern, Katy, and Aleema, Nadine, and Jacob.

During the event, music is playing in three different stages. Food stand surround area tight and some have demonstrate cooking of the spot. There too many vendor and restaurant. I am only picked the one are the best of the night.  I am staring with the host of the place Maestro's at the Starz Center. They have many to offer with their staff chefs. I am sure they can create something new each day. The restaurants in my list tonight are Miguel's Mexican Grill, Queen of Sheba Ethiopian Restaurant, Aqua, Saddle Brook Resort, Chart House Tampa, WaterWorks Bar and Grill, Bar 700 Holidays Inn Westshore, Colombia Restaurant, and Timpano Chophouse. And my most favorite of the night is the Oyster Catcher. These are the restaurants in my list to visit. I like to thanks the Ducky's ladies took a picture with me and I may visit them one day. The only bad thing about this event is too many standing. 

After 9:30 pm, most of the people is start staying away from the food and move to the party on the river front. Tonight is a bit hot but it does not stop us from dancing. Many ladies of the night challenge Nick for a dance off. Rachel also get to one of the stage and dance. What a fun night to be.

Craft Kafe is an interesting restaurant with many flavor. With the restaurant next door to organic grocery store, they can get the fresh ingredients immediately. You also can eat healthy here since they have organic items. 

Definitely stop here for breakfast. I usually not a breakfast person but got to try their breakfast since many reviews indicate they are good. We have order an omelette and two coffees. I have the latte and my wife has cappuccino. I have ask them to decorate the cream in artist way and she did impressed me. Coffee is good and better than Starbucks. 

The omelette we order is the craft omelette. It come with spinach, chicken sausage, mushrooms. It accompanied with hash browns and toss. It is quite tasty. 

The cafe also have other item such as fresh squeezed juice, quiches, vegan pumpkin bread and more. If I pass by here again, I will check them out.

Great ice cream place at Central Avenue St. Petersburg. We like it because of free topping anyway you like. You can get the topping you like with self serve condition. Only the this roll ice cream has it. The day we visited this place is 10 minutes to close. They still served us. There were more people came here after closing and they still serve the customers. This is a A plus for customers who show up late. 

I got the cotton candy roll ice cream. The decoration includes the pink and blue cotton candy on top and a rainbow gummy bear over it. It look pretty. The roll ice cream is delicious. My wife got the King Samoa. This is a Nutella and caramel syrup. It has coconut flake and crackers in it. Lovely roll ice cream. My wife decorated with beautiful topping. It look attractive. It is five star because it worth the money here.

Rare Ethnic Food #54. Laos Cuisine. 

My rating is 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars. It is one of the kind food that you can find. This restaurant step up on the food presentation and taste. I am glad we have a Laos restaurant that can truly like by many. The restaurant took the old Memphis BBQ place. 

Our first course is a complimentary from the restaurant. The chicken rice soup with fried wontons. It is good appetizers. The second course is the combination Par Kow Noi. This is choice 3 item combination with bananas leave fish, pork jerky, and the pork sausage. This great dish to have and try three different street food. 

Our next dish is the Kow Poun Gai - Laos Noodle soup. This is tapioca noodle with chicken. It is delicious. Our last dish is the Frog Leg Khoua Pik. This is frog leg stir fry with Laos chili paste. I like this dish. We also have the Laos chili chicken wing. Those are really good. 

Our experience here is great. Love the place. The only thing is the menu ingredients do not reflect what they serve. They only serve available ingredients. So sometimes you don't get all the ingredients they have mentioned in the menu.

Yelping 1100

My kid will paid for the dinner, why not select a good one. My kid also want to experience the local famous restaurant after he has moved away from home. Bern definitely is well know outside of Tampa that make him to choose this restaurant. 

I have been to Bern for several occasions. One time is by my own and many time are power dinner with the clients. Since then, I have not been back for about five years. Since then, they value of the meal has changed to better. Before it, the side is paid as a la carte. Now they include as part of the meal. It make the value of the dinning improve. 

We were seated at the Bronze Room. I like open room with bronze statues on the wall. It is elegantly decorated. We order the 14 oz chateaubriand for two and a chop steak. Each meal come with onion soup, salad with dressing of your choice, fried onions, zucchini and carrot. The French onion soup is amazing. 

My steak was perfectly grilled. I would said if you come here, chateaubriand is the way to order your steak. No other place do better than here. The chop steak is well presented over the mash potatoes. I like the waiter prepare the whole potato to added all ingredients on it including the bacon bite. 

After the dinner, it was a pleasure to visit their kitchen and the cellar. I saw many famous post of pictures are in this cellar. The dessert room is like a maze. We have the taste of the Bern with five Bern's signature desserts. I like the King Midas and the banana cheese pie. 

Everything is good here. Service- check; food delivery - check; ingredients quality- check; ambient-check; taste-check; chef skill- check. 5 stars.

If you looking for good fish, this place has call themselves best fish in town. In fact, they are right on they have promised. This restaurant is new and popular now. If you are no hungry go for their basket, if you really hungry, go for their dinner plate.

The place mainly fish and shrimp. The choices not just dinner or basket, it has the sandwiches poboy. The kid meal is budget for children. You also can get the family meal to go. Fish includes catfish, whiting, flounder, tilapia, Mahi mahi, haddock. Some fish choice has upgrade price. The shrimp is well prepared. At least the shrimp intestine was removed. They also good size big shrimp. The selection come with grilled, fried, blackened. 

The food was order in counter and they bring it out to you. Price is reasonable for seafood. The seasoning is good for my grilled fish.

Agree with Mark for the tasty food and fast service. I think it is more like 4.5 stars restaurant then actual 5 stars. I wonder why they have to be located at Soho area, why don't they locate near USF area to attract more students and the Busch Garden tourist. Soho already has so many restaurants, I think their pricing is good for the students. 

I will start with their side selection. They have several selection I like. The roasted vegetables, braised white bean and Greek salad is good. For the Greek salad selection is free with kabab. Other combinations need to add $1.69. Tonight we have the steak and salmon kabab. Both of them is flavorful. The steak is in sweet marinated sauce. The reason they get half stars less due to the meat quality,  it is chewy. The salmon was perfect. It come with zucchini in the skew and the salmon juice dip into the zucchini and make it more sophisticated. 

The price is right. I like they use the actual silver ware instead of plastic ware. The place is typical fast food. Definitely will be back.

It is about 4.5 stars for my visit. Round up to 5 stars. We were here about the burger week. They are serving the Jamaican Me Crazy burger. Only this occasion they serve this kind of burger. This burger is top with grilled pineapple, applewood smoked bacon and mango purée. Very tasty. The patty of meat is grass-fed beef. The patty cooked to edge crispy and medium to center. Very good preparation on the grilled. 

If I revisit again, I will try their salmon burger and mushroom and Swiss burger. These two burger will be in my future visit. I also like the burger cook on the order which make the burger really fresh.

The super bowl night and we decide to sit at the bar side of the Bonefish Grilled.  The new added menu for the Bar Bites Menu has added another dimension for the order. The items start at $4 to $12. The bar bites menu have 8 selection and some of the selection have two different type of meat. The appetizer has 11 items to select. The combination of the bar menu and the appetizer create over twenty different selection. This is good business model with Tapas mentality that the bonefish management has provided the customer with more choice. It definite makes the top bar in this area. It will attract more customer in the future.

Tonight we started with the Lamb Lollipop hops. I have this dish at different Bonefish location and I want to make sure different chef can create this dish better. The lamb chop turns up better at this location. The meat is cook to perfect medium and have hint of salt to make the chop taste better without losing it meat taste. We have order the Lobster Street Taco. My wife like this dish and said it have big chunk of lobster meat and worth the $5 item. We have order a bowl of the corn chowder with crab meat. I will advice you order the bowl instead of the cup when you are hungry or two people in the party that can share this dish. The cup and bowl size only a $1 different and you get more on the bowl. We have gone to the appetizer menu and order the Filet Satay. This is new item in the appetizer. It is a center cut filet mignon in soy seasoning and serves with spicy mustard sauce in tomatoes, cucumber, onion.  The meat is tender and soft. The only down side is each pieces is small. However they are delicious. The next appetizer is Singapore Calamari. The calamari is lightly dry pepper breaded and deep fried. It serves sweet spicy sauce. They are crispy and we have left nothing on the plate because they are insane good. The last item is the coconut shrimp with sweet spicy sauce. The dish has six jumbo shrimp and coated with coconut flake. This is a good value dish and it is less than $9. 

We are stuff after all the items. I forgot to mention the Sunday night have happy hours till 6:30. The wine is $3.25 a glass and the draft beer is a dollar. Can't beat that!!! Our server is super nice and attentive. As a result, tonight we are awarding this restaurant with 5 stars.

I have been to TPepin many time for events. Each time I have enjoy my time there. This hospitality center has large room that able to cover big event. Actually many big events have been hold in this location. 

The TPepin has big parking space that may include 300 cars or more. Their room can accommodate up to 1000 people if needed. They have nice reception area with waterfall and fire. Their side walkway include pool table and shuffle board. 

In the ballroom, they have high ceiling decorated lighting which is pleasant. The stage is available in the ballroom for any presentation or announcement. The also have to be side bar and kitchen bar if you decide an open bar with munchies items. 

The bathroom is comfortable. They also has outside patio for any Open grilled item. I have been here several time, I believe it is also good for wedding or anniversary. Puff and Stuff actually has an office there if you need catering.

Review # 3100 - Philippine Bake shop. 

This baked shop next to Jolibee. I wonder they are the same owner. They have something new in the Bay Area. The Filipino baked good. I like the sponge cake. They have many selections. I like the most is their original flavor butter Mamon. 

They have mocha, ube, cheesy, and butter. They also has brownie. Their bake good includes slice of sponge cake like ube overload or mango supreme. Hot food includes the Palabok and arroz caldo. I have not try try this yet. 

The clerk is very helpful. They explain everything to us. Price is a good in a bit high side. Each item we have are good.

This is a grocery restaurant with an interesting ideal. I know the grocery store with restaurant is not the new ideal but a grocery store with great Japanese goods and great restaurants is the first. I would said this is the restaurant to be. 

You can order the food then shop while you wait for your food to be ready. We got a lot Japanese item which cannot be founded in Tampa. For the restaurant we order the chirashi. It is a rice with assorted sashimi tuna, salmon, octopus, unagi, ikura, egg, hokkigai, kanikama, white fish. Very delicious. Second dish we have is the tonkutsu ramen. This pork bone soup is nice and tasty. It has the roll pork belly. Next is my favorite with Cajun shrimp roll. The shrimp is soft shell. It is deep fried to a point the the head and tail is crispy to eat. Basically you cat the entire shrimp with shell and head. The roll is delicious with the Cajun sprinkles. 

It is authentic Japanese food here with a twist.

It is about 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars. This is a place that young and beautiful gatherings place. Great to many young people participating the lunch. With University of Tampa next to it, many students eat here. I like this place because it has variety of shops in one place. They have bookstore, champagne bar, coffee bar, the shop, commerce club upstairs. Very interesting to host many variety. 

We enjoy the restaurant area. For lunch, their food selection is flatbread, sandwiches, small plate, breakfast and salad. Simple but elegant. We got the steak sandwich and tomato prosciutto flatbread. The steak sandwich has a sauce along caramelize shallot in it make the tasty. The flat bread prosciutto is chop piece with pesto sauce which is delicious. Our experience is great. Definitely come in the future. Serve is average. Once the server engaged, we have good service.

Yelping No. 2000!!!

Rare Ethnic Food # 50. Russian and Ukrainian cuisine. 

This little restaurant just opens no long ago. I already like it very much. It is one of the kind in Tampa Bay Area. You have to experience it for it wonderful cuisine. The restaurant locates near USF which make sense for many Russian students study there. The day we have visited, not many customers. It need great word of mouth to spread a good news. 

The menu is simple and delicious. The display in the restaurant is nice with Russian doll. They have the bakery good next to the counter. The only thing I would complain is the chair is too tight. 

What is meaning of "Babushka". It mean triangular folded kerchief for head or it also mean grandmother. Many Russian doll has kerchief over it is part of long tradition. It also can mean your grandma kitchen. Take your pick. 

Our first dish we have order is the Borscht. This is a famous soup with meat, sautéed veggies and beet root. The beet make the entire soup red color. The soup is great during winter. It top with the rosemary. The second dish is Blinchiki. This is a tradition wheat crepe wrap the meat inside. Very unique in many way. 

Our third dish is the Russian dumplings. They have three different fillings inside the dumplings. The Lamb, Beef and Pork. We mixed the pork and beef with the soup base. I like the most is the pork. I would suggest order with soup options. The fourth dish is the Syrniki. This is a pancake made from cheese and wrap with meat options. I like this one too. 

Our fifth and final dish is the Kotlety. It is three minced meat croquettes with a side. We have chose Russian brown rice

Overall our experience have exceed our expectations. It was marvelous meal we have at the dinner. It deserves a 5 stars attention. I would said you may need to change your taste bud when you come to this place. Many items is less sodium. But the taste still there. Russian like to use the sour cream. But I don't.

It was a great ideal a dog park under the bridge. It is good to have roof over the park. The bridge elevated so high which they dog owner don't feel cramp under the roof. It is wide open area that make good use for urban revitalization to the residents at Channelside. 

The park has a big dog area to run. It is great place to play catch. It will challenge to owner to through the ball entire length of the park in diagonal of square park. The many drainage concrete drain pipe in the park to play hide and seek. They are many different height platforms for the dog to rest. You will love the dog to get exercise. Many area to run. The dog fountain to drink the water. Basically you can have dog picnic there. 

We like to thanks the Tampa Hillsborough Expressway Authority to donate this area for the memorial of Deputy Kotfila. His memorial bring a lot good by serving the community.

This is the fourth time I am here. This is the first time we have seen full restaurant capacity. Please reserve ahead to get good seat. Tonight is the first Saturday of the month and they have the flamenco show and is free to the diner. This is happen every first Saturday of the month. The show is perform by a husband and wife team. The beautiful flamenco is performed by his wife Esther Suarez. She wears a tradition flamenco dress with fire lighting foot step pounding to stage floor. The husband Victor Moreno performing the Spanish guitar and the Spanish song that attract our attention and pleasant to the ear. The combination of song and dance entertainment make the night unforgettable.  

Tonight we have started with the appetizer we love the most the lamb chop and follow by the mussel. The lamb chop is prepared by cutting the meat to rib bone and grilled to the perfection. The ingredient do not have the lamb smell at all. It is bite size happiness. The mussel is cook in garlic wine sauce. I have finish the garlic sauce with the dip of dinner roll. Mmmm good. 

Today we order a bottle Black Sheep French Cabernet Sauvignon $24 a good value same as whole sale price. We have pair with our entree tonight. We have the New York Strip steak with mushroom wine sauce. The meat is prepare with the perfect wine sauce that go with the grilled steak. It came with broccoli. The other entree is Banger and Mash. It is the the English Sausage and the mash potato. The English sausage is insane delicious. It is better than the German sausage. Tasty!!!  The mash potato is mix with garlic sauce and spice. It is good that we have nothing left in the plate. 

This restaurant owner wife is the main chef. You will enjoy every creation of her dish. We close out the dinner with the dessert crumble. Sweet fruit in the crunchy topping and top with vanilla ice cream. 

To night is perfect that we finish with the flamenco performance with live Spanish song. The flamenco dancer pound the floor and vibrate the noise and vibrate your heart. The slow motion of the flamenco dancer express the beautiful ancient art. The rhythm
is great to go with the dance every move. Can said that better, you have to experience yourself by every first Saturday of the month. 

Overall this is great place to be. Some family bring their children to experience the live show.

Our revisit is great. The service and the waiter are very responsive. Tonight we have a chance to try variety of food. We already know this restaurant have good skill. But tonight they are better. We have finally try their Peking duck. This dish needs to be pre-ordered a day or two before you come here. They will not serve you this dish if you just walking to the restaurant. 

What is really the Peking duck? In the Yuan dynasty many variety of the roast duck has been done. Until the Ming dynasty the Peking Roast Duck is fully developed. This dish is serve to many diplomats who visit China. Henry Kissinger may be the first diplomat from US who lay the road for Richard Nixon have the first invite on this dish. 

This duck preparation is closely guarded recipes in Peking. For my limited understanding the duck is dressed with the sauce and hung dry for two days before it roast in the oven. This allows the sauce marinated into the skin and duck meat. Because it was hung dry the skin is easily separated. Our dish tonight have display the best skin and meat separation. Meat is very lean. It serve with bun with hoisin sauce and scallions. Yummy good. 

Many will said may be Valrico may have good food but is too far to try their restaurant. I would said this is two of the restaurant in this area worth for a drive. I would suggest you pre-order the Peking duck before you come.

The TECO (Tampa Electric Company) Manatee Viewing center is a place to be when the outside temperature high of the day is below 68 degree. There is when the manatees gather at the warm water. Florida Manatee which is the West Indian manatee is very gracious creature in the water. The Manatee is found at many natural spring that maintain 72 degree of the temperature water. The sailor from the old time has mistaken them as mermaid of the sea.

There is no surprise at this time of year, the manatees are gathering near the TECO power plans that discharge their cooling water into the gulf. TECO using the water to cool their power plants and discharge the high temperature water into the Big Bend Bay of the gulf. As a result the water near the power plants was raise to 78 degree that attracts the manatee to reside near the bay. Today we are seeing over 150 manatees that gather at this place by their nature instinct. Although there is requirement from the EPA restriction of the clean water and air discharge, TECO has used this opportunity for the public relation to provide a center of the refuge for the manatee and the curious tourist. With the combination of the volunteer and partner of the TECO, this is a place to be visited when you come to Tampa bay at the cooling time. Today we spot a baby manatee that scratches his face with it three nail fin which is very adorable. Who can ague to the face of the manatee when they look at you? You can see some of the manatee back was hit by the boater. This remind us at the no wake zone the boater needs to slow down and respect the animal.

The center has included the bay walk elevated above the Big Bend Bay. It also has the observation tower at the nature trail. The parking may be a challenge if you come late, and you have to park at the overflow lot is half miles away. Come before 10 am is the best time if you want to park your car closer.

The name matches what they serve. Mr. Penguin definitely a cold serve. We are welcome the cold serve in Florida since we have hot weather most of the time. 

I like thank Nick to show this place to us. We like their combination of the Italian ice with the soft serve ice cream. This combination is work for me. I have the vanilla soft serve with the bubble gum flavor Italian ice. They put them in layer. We actually can pick to flavors of Italian ice but I didn't do it since I like bubble gum flavor. The ice cream with the two type of mix calls gelati. I like Mr. Penguin creative bring other sensation to the community. 

The soft serve can be vanilla, chocolate or the swirl of two flavors. The Italian ice has a lot to select. You can ask for the try out taste before you make your order. This place is dog friendly.

My final farewell to the restaurant owner and chef for their retirement of this restaurant was last night dinner. After 21 year of long running, the Cafe European will close their restaurant. The last night of dinner will be 8/1/2015. After that it will be close

I met the new owners of the restaurant there too.  They have not decided what they going to do yet but will open a different restaurant. The new restaurant will be different than the existing restaurant. 

Thanks to Suzy and Mike for choosing Tampa for 21 years. This is the restaurant I love and the farewell is last night dinner. They have one more night which is tonight. For 6 years we have get to know about their restaurant, we enjoy Suzy delicates chef skill. You will not find a British who can cook like this in town. The best dish is the Beef Wellington that with the puffy dough and seasoning red wine sauce and mushroom is the best in town. If you watch Gordon Ramsay Hell Kitchen show, he always test the young chef for this dish. Difficult dish to cook and make harmony of two worlds. I like their lamp chop appetizer is one of the best in town. Very consistent every time we're here. 

I wish them very good journey of their break from restaurant business. Farewell my friends.

Great Chinese restaurant. The old ABC was located at St. Pete and now the the owner move to this location not long ago. When they just first open I was not impress. Today they are really do a good job. 

We have order a salt and pepper Whole Lobster and three dim sum dishes for dinner. The dim sum are shrimp stuff egg plant, leak steam dumpling and the beef tripe. The egg plant is well prepared since the skin is soft enough. Obviously the egg plant is deep fried with ground shrimp paste and hot plate grilled the surface and added the black beam sauce. If the chef did not prepare correctly the skin will be tough to bite through and you will end up leave the skin on the side. However this chef did correctly and is yum to consume. 

Today feature is the the Lobster. They are running the special with each lobster $15. Can't beat this price. They can prepare ginger scallion, Hong Kong style with egg white, steam, salt and pepper.......
You got to try it now while they are running the special. The way they have the lobster cut to 10 pieces. The first cut is remove head then the crawl. The body is cut to 6 pieces. They will deep fried and stir fry with salt, green scallion, onion and jalapeño. This dish you need to learn how to eat from the shell. 

If you have group 4 or more, I recommend to order the fillet flounder. The fish meat fillet in cube and easy to eat. Many people don't know the fried side bone can be eaten. The side bone is taste like crunchy yum food. Please be sure to chew or crush before you swallow because some time you chose too close to the main bone that cannot be swallow.  

Overall the service is good today. We have been back and will be back for more.

Hillsborough Community College Culinary School "Gourmet Room" is getting it name with beautiful and sensual dining. This is the perfect academic and restaurant to close my 300th series review. Thanks to students and teacher who serve the good food. If you like to know the website to joint in, please go to Grace H review. 

We have a pleasure to celebrate a friend be late birthday here. The setting is nice with beautiful art on the wall. It is a table cloth serving if you want to have a nice diner with your love one with very good cost. I would encourage put more tip money in the plate to support the scholarship for the school since they are not for profit. Come and try out their food since each week is different country until their semester ended of their serving. 

Tonight we have the Greek theme since I miss the season opener last week. The first course is the Greek Salad and The Lentil Soup. The Greek salad is a classic dish in many Greek restaurant. I like the pita bread on top of the salad. It is crispy and top with few pieces of sea salt. The lentil soup is garnish with spinach. The flavor has a twist mixture of the fragrant of food. 

The main course is the Pork Tenderloin serves with Orzo Pasta. The orzo pasta shape like rice cook with olive oil tomato with a bit basil leave. The pork tenderloin is seasoned and baked in oven. The exterior was well salt and the seasoning that went into the meat.  Then it is sliced and served to the customer.  

My favorite is the dessert. Tonight it end with Baklava. I have eat many of baklava and never like it because many of them are sitting too long or wrap in the plastic before it serve. The different of this baklava is freshly prepared with crispy layers of crush. The infill of nuts are crispy and perfect to enjoy. 

They still have four weeks left before the semester run out. Come and try the good cooking and support the students.

I like the mixture of this restaurant. I have been here several time and they have not disappoint me. The service is great and the owner of the restaurant paid attention to the customer. She get in sushi wrap if they are behind. She gets to the front serving the table if they need help in this area. I like mom and pop shop like this and the yelper need to support them to stay alive. 

This is a restaurant that is great for vegan or regular eater customer. Most of of the people don't know there is a vegetarian menu. You have to ask for the vege menu that not shown often. In the vege menu they have a roll call the funky monkey roll. It is a bit sweet and go well spicy tuna roll. It neutralizes the spiciness. What is actually the Funky Monkey Roll??  This is a vegan dish and they are pretty good. It is Inari (sweet tofu skin), avocado, cucumber, daikon, and tempura banana, rolled in seaweed and rice, topped with mango and avocado. These are complicated combination and they are working well with each material. 

I always use the spicy tuna roll as a judgment for the sushi chef skill. Some sushi chef likes to add chop of cucumber in the roll. This is incorrect and it is occupied the actual tuna space and reduce the amount of tuna provided. The correct way is to dice the tuna not ground and then add quail egg. Then add sesame oil, spicy chili, a bit salt and roll with the sushi rice. This roll not requires and soy sauce or wasabi and it is good enough to eat as it is. This restaurant did it A+. 

I have order the Japanese Ramen with pork belly. They did not make me jump out the seat but is good enough to enjoy. Today I have order the Chashu Pork Belly Ramen - Served with chashu pork belly, pork pot stickers, boiled eggs, corn, scallions, naruto (pink spiral fish cake) and menma (pickled bamboo shoots)

We have close our lunch with a desert is big enough to share for 4 people. It is the Banana Bomb - Tempura fried banana & dark chocolate wrapped in spring roll skin served with vanilla ice cream & assorted sauces. The display is a wow factor and it also taste like a wow factor. Love it.

Thursday and Saturday night have dates night special. Please check their web site. If you check in with Yelp, you get a free shot of sake. The best is the sake came with flavor. I like the Fuji Apple flavor.

This actually 4.5 stars not yet 5 stars boba place. Since there is no half stars, the place is cool, I have give them 5 stars. 

Chewy Boba originally from Orlando. This may be the first Chewy in Tampa. Although they did not carry special flavor like the Orlando Colonial chain, but they have some flavor I have no try before. 

The decorated the place like the stars war movies Chewbacca character because it close to its name. The place has some videos games, board game, card game and more. You pretty much can spend a night there to play and talks. 

I have been here twice. I got the winter Mellon boba tea and the Okinawa boba tea. Both of them is very good. I like the drink. They always add the boba to the bottoms or quarter level of the cup. There are plenty of boba to chew. I hope they keep this consistent. The tea is decent.

In search of the taco place. I look up Dianna review and decide to try this place. You can said is unique place in the Bay Area with authentic Mexican food. I have not seen our recent taco crazy taco queen Kristal checkin to this place. I finally have a place to bit her to the punch. 

It was surprise to me this place have good taco at very economical scale. I have three tacos and a margarita for total of $11. I have the steak, pastor and lamb. This is the first time I have the lamb taco. It is very different than other taco place. Very tasty. It come in chunk. Good in value for this taco. 

The other two taco is not bad either. During the weekday including Friday, they run the two margaritas for $5 from 2:00 pm to 7:00 pm. Very good deal. With economical pricing, friendly serving, and good food, they deserve 5 stars.

Rare Ethnic Food No. 19

Indian biryanis is an beautiful like Chinese fried rice.  Chinese use the soy sauce with other ingredients. The Indian biryanis is using the Indian spice mixed with meat. The liking of how biryanis taste is up to each individual. Some like heavy spice with hot chili and some like it mild with touch of spice. 

The selection of biryanis here is a lot. Start with egg biryanis, boneless mutton, paneer veggies, Kheema, anthrax chicken, Avakai, ulavacharu and more. We have order regular chicken biryanis and Avakai biryanis. Tha avakai include mango pickle. Very interesting. I like it spicy hot. But if you feel is too hot, they have yogurt on the side. 

Service is good, the biryanis is excellent. Good enough spice. My wife said it is to hot after 5 spoon full. Love to come back to try them all.

This bridge is a symbol of all bridge in Florida. Skyway connect the two counties and provide the vital connections across the Tampa Bay. It is an awesome fan shaped cable with sail boat feature. The golden cable stay show the sunset color when drive on it. 

The old was hit and damage during 1980. Many have died that day. The new bridge was completed at 1987. There is a movie Punisher was film here. It is actual at start of movie, Frank Castle stand at the mid main span and have panorama view of the bridge. This bridge symbolizes Tampa Bay. 

If you take a cruise port of Tampa, it will pass under it. I remember my cruise to Mexico was just a few feet below the bridge. Awesome view. 

This bridge is tall. During the high wind condition, the bridge was not safe to travel on due to tipping. Especially for the semi-trailer truck. The toll is collected from the traveler who using the bridge and fund the bridge maintenance.

It is not yet full 5 stars. It is about 4.5 stars in my book. The reason they are 4.5 stars is the value of the food vs the quality and taste of the food make the list above 4 stars. A reasonable price with decent food. 

I started with the Guanabana Juice. It has great fruit smell. Mixed with 2% milk make this drink very desirable. We also has the shrimp empanada. This my first time with the shrimp infills. Very interesting. We got the Fish Fritter. The fish is salty fish. It is another interesting dish. 

Our entree are the tilapia and steak mofongos. Tilapia is ok. The steak is better. The mofongo is good because they are cooking with pork material inside. The mofongo is better than other place I have tasted. Because it is soft and no dry - the key of good mofongo. 

We end up with home made churros and coconut flan. Great balance of flavor. I will revisit them because they have reasonable price.

I love downtown. But most of the time is difficult to find great food with reasonable price. Fusion Bowl has solved many lunch office workers with affordable price. The location also is prime location next to county office building. 

I was surprised we able to find a "great" drink place with decent food. The drink. I have the mixed berry with condensed milk with coffee jelly. This is great drink. This drink has many berry type and herb. We also has a good lavender drink and mango drink. All these drinks were good. But the mixed berry is the best. 

I got the beef noodle pho, lemon chicken fresh roll and grilled pork bowl. I said they are decent and acceptable. The quantity enough for lunch and better than fast food.  Lemon chicken is good to start. 

The store owner was friendly. I like this small business. They have a lot customer visiting during Sunday lunch. Imagine weekday afternoon.

Yelping 2300. Rare Bay Area Museum Number 57. 

The regular price to visit the museum is $15 per adult. It is well worth the money. The membership is $100 a year and two is $150. During the membership drive, the discount is 50%. 

This museum has items that are eye popping moment. The museum featured wonderful pieces of glass sculptures creation. I have been to Venice and look at the Murano glass, but this museum glad is measured up to the standard and some of the creativity is exceed them. 

There is one that has infinite window with triangle glass reflection. It is endless. Some has series of wings like the Phoenix. One of the piece has the glass fibers form the sculpture. Like tail of the whale. One ball capture the flower with thousands bee surrounds it. One of the piece painted, shatter, then reassemble. 

These arts are beautiful. The color is vibrant. The shape like a women. The imagination take you to different dimension. After your visit, you can imagine more. So imagine you will be back for more.

We were here during lunch time and the restaurant is busy. Seem like they doing well. We avoid the wait of table a straight to bar area. Only three people surround the bar. Later we saw our bar tender also serve the table at bar area. We realize they serve more than the bar only. However, they do have two bar tender for this area and did not slow down the service. At night time they have four bar tenders. 

We put our order in and request to be hurry since we have meeting elsewhere. We have order the Baby Back Rib and my friend order the Brick Chicken. The Baby Back meat fall off the bone. You can use the folks to pick up the meat. My friend like the brick chicken. We also order an appetizer Roasted Wing. These wings were dry rub with good marinated sauce. It is drum wing prepare like popcorn. Great to have. 

We were in and out in 45 minutes. Not bad. The waiter paid attention to detail like serving to your right. Bring a hot wet tower with lemon if you use your finger for the food to clean your hand. This is about 4.5 stars restaurant. Half stars different is I think their food is a bit expensive but it does measure for the price.

The Pint and Brew is a unique bar near the county line of Hillsborough and Pinellas. It is serving the people of Dunedin, Tarpon Spring, and Oldsmar. Sometimes they have guitar jam there. 

The bar offer many type of beer and have a good collection of local Brewer. Tonight is pumpkin smash night. All beer are adding the pumpkin spice or pumpkin flavor. The beer has some twist.  This is actually good for dark beer. It enhance the flavor.  I have order the Southern Tier and it is quite a taste after they add pumpkin flavor. 

The bar is very lively. It has shuffle board, dat games and more. The brew selections are attractive to people. You can have the $10 flight with four glasses of different beer. That way you can sample 4 different beer. Small dog is allow in there. They also have outside sitting. We have shuffle board challenge from the local. We have a lot of fun there. Grace got free popcorn for munchie.

Yelping 1900. Authentic Cultural Food No. 47. Center East Chinese Cuisine

This restaurant use to call Tao Asian Fusion. Recently has changed their name. The menu is also changed. This restaurant basically has Shandong and Peking cuisine. Very close to Szechuan cuisine. This area of China eat slightly different from other side of country. Since it is at the capital, the cuisine includes many area of China due to dynasty dining. 

I like many items in the menu and the special of the day. It has an attractive menu. We got the sautéed pig kidney. The chef is skillful not to let the ingredients over cook. It is nice to see to serve this dish right. Our next dish is the beef noodle with pickle veggies. The beef is marinated and braised for some time. 

We also got the fish with black bean sauce. This black bean sauce with chili is a nice combination. The fish is fried with whole fish no head. So you need to skill eater to order this dish. Our last entree is the Dong Po Pork. I love this dish when they prepared correctly. This is Pork belly with skin and braised in sweet sauce. It need to be braised over time to soften the tough skin and meat. Which they have done that. I would recommend this dish if you come to visit. 

We order the beef pie from the special menu. It is special street food category. If they carry this dish. Order the pork pie. Overall experience is excellent. Enjoy the good cooking. We have been back twice.

4.5 stars restaurant. Not yet 5 stars to my book. This restaurant has plus at back of the name. This mean they beyond just poke only. The restaurant also has the Vietnamese cuisine. So you can get poke and cook meal. I got best of both worlds. 

I start with mixed poke. I got the base as rice and protein as tuna. They are generous for one scoop of protein. This is why they have 5 stars. I got all the mixed in ingredients and topping that have have no up charge. The sauce are poke sauce, eel and special ask for sesame oil. It was really good for mixed in. I would pre them to do mixed in ingredients and protein separately than added into the base then add topping. But they don't have this procedure. They do put the sauce over base then on top of mixed in ingredients. This area they can improve. 

We also got the combination pho and grilled pork bun. Their Vietnamese side food also delicious. The grilled pork is well marinated and their pho is deep with herb smell.

#ThankYouThursday. 

I have chosen Terra Gaucha for today visit for lunch dine in experience. Thank you for hanging there during pandemic. I think your restaurant has good high ceiling dining hall. No doubt the great Brazilian Grille in Tampa Bay Area. We were lucky to have you. Interior design is great. Good place for power lunch and bring the the client. 

With that said. This is place for meat. Love it. Buffet style. People may be afraid of close contact because of buffet. Thank you to make it safer for people come to the table. Before each individual come to the buffet booth, each one need to put on the hand gloves. So the share spatula is not touch. The buffet table already have partial cover on top. But I think more cover or complete lid cover is better. We saw a few completely cover such as soup item is very good. 

The meat bring to the table is well perform. Server wear gloves and mask. Definitely great to visit. Keep serving our community and we are looking forward to see you again.

Currently the restaurant are not open for public to dine in. It is takeout only. In order to attract customers and regularity, they push out several rewards systems. They have clover points system. 50 point cumulative got the free peach pudding with milk. 100 point got Tao Beef Burrito, 200 point spicy chicken and 300 whole grilled fish. Basically is 10% off item you cumulative as point. 

The also run weekly half price promotions. Currently is the grilled lamb leg half price. You can choose spicy or salt and pepper. I prefer the salt and pepper. It is delicious. Other item include dong Po pork belly, fiery shrimp are among the best. You should try those dishes. The lunch special is comparable with and fast food outside with great value. It also includes a soft drink and make the deal sweet with about $8. Can beat that. 

Call ahead is the key. They usually need 20 minutes to prepare. Food are very nicely seasoned and go with wine at home. Are you hungry now.

Review #2900. Rare ethnic food #70. Iraqi Cuisine. 

This review go to our local unique restaurant. I have many Middle Eastern food but this one is different. If you come to visit, I would suggest get the Iraqi Masgouf fish dish. The restaurant has very interesting meat dish in the menu. All food is interesting. 

We got the Iraqi Masgouf. This dish is not cheap but it has good quantity and quality. The entire come with marinated grilled fish. The side dish have Fries, green chili, butter bread, two mixed veggies, and more. The fish is delicious with bone. The other dish we have is the  dolce ribeye steak. This dish we select the rice. I like the spice up rice. The steak was well marinated. It is tasty to the bone. 

The restaurant has a yellow bird. It sing for us while we are eating. The chai tea is complimentary. The soup was special complimentary. We got the lentil and the okra soup. Service is good. Love to eat there for good food. The bread is special with their own made butter.

This is brand new Brazilian Steakhouse. It is a chain restaurant with well train staff to get this restaurant run smoothly at the first month. The lunch is cheaper than the dinner. The all you can eat steak also includes all you can eat buffet for other miscellaneous items. 

The steak is awesome. Especially I like the lamb chop, chicken heart, skirt steak, top sirloin. All steak is well seasoning. Especially the chicken heart and chicken drum stick. The chicken drum stick is marinated in wine sauce. Very delicious. There are wave and wave of meat to cut. They also bring out big giant leg of lamb. 

During this time on the brand new opening, they have 10% off the bill. On the buffet table, they have heart of palm, Smoke salmon, caramel mushrooms and more. 

Tip - don't forget to ask for the steak sauce such chimichuri, hot sauce, mint jelly to go with steak and lamb chop. 

Service is excellent. These include the speed, attention to detail, clean up, and frequently check on the table. Definitely 5 stars.

Rare Authentic Food #38 - Florida own seasoning crab. 

I am surprised Nick and Tina did not smell this one out since both of them love crab. This restaurant now is my number one store to go finger food for crab. It is king of the crab store. Best ever. If you want some finger food during this football season, this will be the one if you don't mind to get down dirty with finger for limited crab meat. 

Today I got two types of crab. The garlic crab and fried crab. Both of them are excellently exceedingly my expectations. The garlic crabs are finger licking good. 3 crab for $7.50. I also got the seasoning fried crab for $11. Man!!! Those are good. The seasoning is deeeeeeeeep into the crab since the crab is minorly crack to allow the seasoning get into the crab meat. They have other item. But I think you should concentrate on the crabs. 

Am I coming back. Hell yes!!!! Love the food. By the way this is just a take out store. You can order 15 minutes ahead so it won't be any wait. The crab is fresh. The fried crab is normally bigger than garlic crab. There is not sit down area. Only carry out.

Yelping 1400 - Rare Ethic Food # 41

This one go to the local restaurant which is unique in many way. This Turkish kitchen offer many items I have never seen before. It is amazing to try them all. I would recommend friends to try this restaurant which is extremely good. 

To begin, we start with oven baked Hummus with added Turkish sausage. This hummus is mixed with mozzarella. This dish come with lavash bread. This is my first time have this dish. It is huge bread. The bread blow up is actually made up of hot air trap inside that bigger than my head. It is interesting. 

The main dishes include Levrek- Whole Mediterranean Sea  Bass. The fish is grilled. I like the crispy fish skin with the marinated sauce. The fish is fresh and great to enjoy. The second dish is Pirzola - marinated grilled lamb chop. It come with 4 chops. Very good flavor. 

We end the night with special dessert. The Kunefe is one of the specialty of the night. It is string type Filo Dough stuff with cheese and sugar syrup. It was interesting to pull them apart. String dough make the this dessert unimaginable delicious. 

Overall this is solid five stars restaurant. Good service.

One of my best restaurant list in the Bay Area. I have been to this place many time and decide to give the a full review. The restaurant originally start at the Water Ave Armenia location. Then they build the Bistro at this location (Hillsborough Ave). Then they have open the Gainesville and Sarasota. I have been to all of them except the newly open restaurant in Ocala. 

They have consistence tasting through out these locations. Tonight we have long distance friend visit us and we decide to take them here. Since tonight is January 1 no reservation. Usually the weekend and holiday they don't take reservation. We have waited 30 minute for our table. We have order the sizzling ginger scallion frog leg, crab and fish maw soup, steam snapper with ginger and soy source, duck raisin fried rice and the grouper egg plant hot pot and the appetizer of scallop in salt and pepper. The salt and pepper scallop is wet coated with flour and deep fry then stir fry with Garlic, pepper and salt. They did not over coat the ingredient and make the scallop soft inside. This is a delicious appetizer. 

We have the main dishes of the raisin duck fried rice. The duck is roasted and the meat is chop in small pieces and stir fry with raisin, egg and long grain rice. The fry rice is fantastic. The egg and fish maw soup has make a good use of ingredient to create the flavor of the soup. Add an hint of red vinegar and white pepper, it will enhance the taste. The sizzling fog leg is a bit down today. The frog leg is coated and deep fried. However the chef make the coating too thick today. Usually they are good thin coating to keep the leg meat intact and stir fry with ginger and scallion source. The steam fish is perfect with fresh snapper and ginger in soy source and sesame oil. We have two pounder fish. We also have the egg plant and grouper hot pot. The egg plant is cook in the fish source and use the hot pot to braise and soften the egg plant fiber. The mix of grouper the the egg plant is a pleasant dish to eat. 

Overall we are very satisfy with our meal and service. I wish they allow reservation to make the the restaurant more attractive.

It is good Italian restaurant at Dale Mabry. One thing make them high stars rating is their food. Good choices of menu selection. Sauce is great. Presentation of the fish also nice. We were here for the dinner. The interior is nice with wide open dining hall. One thing can improve is the seat cushion of the booth need to resurface because when we seat, the seat cushion is sink. 

I have the scallops sambuca. The dish come with 4 big seared sea scallops. The pasta is the bow tie pasta. The sambuca sauce was accompanied well. The pasta also includes the shredded bacon. The dish is big with take home for next day. My wife has branzino of the sea. It is Mediterranean Sea bass. The fried the whole fish with checked score. It allow the interior of the fish fully fried. They also give a thought to stand the fish on the spinach bed and plum tomatoes. It is well presented. By standing the fish instead lay flat. It allows both side of the fish fully crispy while eating. 

The pre-meal includes garlic rolls. It has good garlic butter oil on top. Our service is good. Our food definitely impressive. Love to come back for more.

It is about 4.5 stars. Onur is part market and part restaurant. This is a Turkish market for item like Turkish delight and all the Turkish goods such as tunas jam, coffee, spices, flour, marinated steak and more. 

We got some of the cookies and milk drinks mixed and a kabab to go. We have the chicken kabab and it comes with veggies. You will not believe the kabab is good. Love the juicy chicken kabab. 

The menu of the restaurant was easy to select. The price is affordable in compare to full middle eastern restaurants. The kabab was prepared in ten minutes. In compare to restaurants I usually waited for half hours. This is the plus to prepare the food quick and quality.
